characters: AND SLAM INTO ESSEX CAPITAL ADVISERS/CONFERENCE ROOM
AND RIGHT BACK TO CENTRAL PARK
AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART
AND ALONG THE BANKS OF THE PERSIAN GULF
SLAM INTO THE FRONTIER FUND/TRADING PIT
THE BURJ AL ARAB PREMIERE SUITE
FLASH TO AN OLD BRICK BUILDING
NOW ROBBY'S HALF OF THE SCREEN SPLITS INTO 6 SMALL BOXES
AND THREE CHARTS NOW FILL THE SCREEN
AND THE HUGE PAINTING ON THE WALL
AND RIGHT BACK TO BOWLING GREEN PARK
THEN SLAM INTO THE DANIELS ACTIVIST FUND/ALLAN DANIELS'S
AND THEN FOX BUSINESS NEWS COVERAGE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a summer day. The heat floats above the pavement. A cab waits in the lot. The large gates of New York's largest prison open and tod group of newly released emerge. They pass a guard who lifts up a copy of The USA Today to reveal the headlines and date that tells us it's 2002. Amongst this group we find a man carrying a small duffel. And we know this man. He is Gordon Gekko. But he is not as slick as we remember... he doesn't have gleam in his eyes or that gel in his hair. No, this is a very different version of the man we remember... because there's nothing behind those eyes... nothing we can read anyway. And he just stands there... coldly watching his recently freed brethren greet their wives and children... reunitin with the people who waited for them... the people who lov them. The cab slowly pulls up and Gordon holds up a finger... w a minute. He glares over to the entrance of the lot... waiting for his people... but they don't come. And the cab waits... Gordon stands there... in the heat.. completely disappointed... and completely alone. And we...

dialogues.speaker: SLAM BACK INTO
dialogues.text: As the white letters reappear on the screen... "As a result... the American economy collapsed... Taken from an article about the pre-crash 1929... ... written by Alan Greenspan."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny, the more we find ourselves slaves of chance... the more superstitious we become. 2.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM INTO
dialogues.text: A gorgeous June Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that would make Andrew Zabel one superstitious motherfucker. Find ANDREW ZABEL, mid 50s, shaved-head and in good shape

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He started every day the same exact way. He would walk his dogs then leave his Gramercy Park condo at seven am on the dot. As Andrew leaves 36 East Gramercy Park East, an impressiv building made of white stone. Andrew wears a suit and holds an umbrella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he would take an umbrella with him even when there was no chance of rain... As Andrew heads to a newsstand and throws the INDIAN CLER familiar nod. And without saying a word, the clerk knows exactly what to give him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd buy a journal, a tin of chocolate Altoids and a cold bottle of Poland Springs water.

dialogues.speaker: 23RD ST SUBWAY STATION
dialogues.text: As Andrew bounds down the stairs and through the gate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had timed it out so he wouldn't have to wait more than three minutes for the uptown five train. As Andrew emerges out to the platform and sees the headli from the 5 train coming down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you could say that day was like every other... And as the train approaches... holding that Wall Street Journal... the bottle of water and that tin of Altoids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except for one thing... ... Andrew Zabel simply steps forward and falls onto the track. 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as the train SLAMS into US...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which holds for an uncomfortably long moment, then... "Money Never Sleeps" graces the screen... and we move dow below the letters to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now filling the screen. It's of the Dow Jones Industrial Average. It's for the year 2008 and it's down to the right... not good. A circle marks Friday June 13th. Follow a blue line back three days and stop. Another circle is now formed and Matthew Good's "Giant" rings out... CARD: JUNE 6th 2008... 8 DAYS EARLIER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening titles... the workplace throng... listening to th iPods, checking their Blackberrys and sipping their Starbucks. Move with this throng, to the Matthew Good tune, under th opening titles, past 745 Seventh Avenue, the Lehman Broth building... with that giant ticker that rounds the buildi posting Dow 12,579.76 -- +119.86 And keep moving... all is normal in the financial center the universe. Land on a impressive modern building made of glass and st then climb up it to the top... to the penthouse office suites. And push in through the window to be in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impressive office with a 180 degree view of southern Manhattan. Zabel sits behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, open it. And across from Andrew Zabel sits JACOB L. MOORE... who h his bonus check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? On the wall over Zabel's shoulder runs an electronic tick with the major indices and just one stock... ticker KZI.. Keller Zabel Investments. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that because of the problems with the credi--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw the credit derivative desk, I don't understand half the shit they do anyway. Zabel forces a smile. But Jacob can tell something's wron with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Zabel doesn't answer... he just nods to the envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it. He opens the envelope and looks down at the check. $1,450,000. And he can barely contain his excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. And we get a good look at Jacob now... boyish features th display humility with a trace of mischievousness thrown i He's definitely sexy, definitely cerebral and definitely winning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm proud of you, Jacob. And Jacob tries to play it cool as he looks up at the electronic ticker on the wall... 12,592.46 -- +132.46... $71.67... +$3.12.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Princess cut, platinum banded, five carat, completely colorless round center stone with a medium girdle and excellent polish. Pull back to be in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob inspects the ring then looks up to the fey salesman

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's nice. But here's the thing... He looks around the store for a moment, then... 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see the "fuck you" room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The "fuck you" room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. The room where you sell me a fuck you ring for fuck you money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The private client foyer. And with a big smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two bedroom in a Murray Hill high rise. Jacob watches Fox Business on his tv. A much nicer, much bigger, much flatt plasma sits against the wall under it waiting to be installed. A promo plays for a magazine show being narrated by Cody Willard.

dialogues.speaker: CODY WILLARD, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night we explore the excesses of hedge fund managers. Different pictures flash on the screen of private jets, massive mansions, expensive watches and wines.

dialogues.speaker: CODY WILLARD, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: Whether they're spraying $5000 a bottle champagne at Voile Rouge in Saint-Tropez, ordering a $10,000 Martini at The Algonquian Hotel with a diamond on the bottom or eating a gold dusted $175 hamburger at the Wall Street Burger Shoppe... Now the flashes are of some of the top HEDGE FUND MANAGER the business that we'll see later... one of them is a man named BRETTON WOODS... maybe we hold a little longer on h to get a good look... Mid 40s, good looking and refined.

dialogues.speaker: CODY WILLARD, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: ... these cowboys of finance always seem to land on their feet. Jacob lets out a little laugh and mutes the tv. He grabs the phone and makes a call... 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're at the fund raiser tonight but I wanted to say hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, best part... getting my bonus check. Worst part... He grabs a framed picture of her and looks at it. She's in workout gear, wearing earbuds, obviously just of run, caught off guard and thus flipping him the finger... it's adorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it was right after I ordered lunch and I remembered that we're not seeing each other this weekend. And he finishes his message to her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, text me yours and I'll read them in my sleep. I love you. As Jacob disconnects and looks out the window... looking at Third Avenue twinkling up into Midtown.

dialogues.speaker: AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART
dialogues.text: Where the blue line travels down the Dow trend line, down to the right then stops on Thurs June 12th.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large space lined with long desks that hold five TRADER each. Each trader has two phones and three huge monitors front of them. It's loud and frenetic. Most of the traders are under thi five, it's a young person's game. Jacob heads in and takes his seat at his desk. It's large than the others and anchors the room... this is his domai Fox Business plays on each of the screens that line the s ubiquitous. (A note, when possible, business news will be droning from television sets throughout this movie in bg. as it is the current soundtrack of New York these days) A trader named WILLY shouts out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jake, Glass Works is up nine points on earnings, you want to unload some? 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob confirms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's get closer to home. A trader named AUDRY turns to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jacob, re Willy) Where's his hat? Willy glares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind your own business, Audry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to wear Pfizer on my forehead for a full week... so post it up, bitch. Willy pleads with Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Jake, it's embarrassing. Jacob just shrugs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stock goes down, you wear the crown... them's the rules. Audry grins in victory. Willy shakes his head, grabs a marker, scribbles somethin down on a post-it then places it on his forehead. It read "I bought Toll Brothers at $24" and he has to wear it all week. And Jacob laughs... now looking up at the electronic ticker... KZI $60.21... -$2.25...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ultra exclusive club reserved for Wall Street money-me Hollywood players, gangstas and supermodels. TI's "Whatever You Like" blares. The dance floor is packed with New York's privileged drap in Prada and dripped in sweat. Jacob heads a table of five men who are all in suits. The are all in various areas of finance... a HEDGE FUND Portf Manager, a DERIVATIVES TRADER, a PRIVATE EQUITY CFO and a QUANT ANALYST. The quant stares at a HIGH CLASS CALL GIRL working the ro across the way. He then turns back to the guys with... 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl like that cost a thousand bucks last year... now it's up to five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting priced out of the hooker bubble? Confirming in frustration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn bull market's killing my sex life. They all laugh.

dialogues.speaker: HEDGE FUND PM
dialogues.text: Don't worry... it's not such a bull market anymore. She'll be trading at five hundred soon enough. The laughter dies down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Jacob) It's true. I'm actually shocked KZI gave you a bonus of that size.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? Private Equity CFO nudges Hedge Fund PM in reference to t woman who just took the seat at the next table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm going long Boeing.

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE EQUITY CFO
dialogues.text: Oh, I didn't notice. Confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? The 787 is having problems. As Hedge Fund PM opens a bottle of Krug, Clos du Mesnil 1 and pours it into the flutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Derivatives Trader) Why? Why are you so shocked? Offering Jacob a flute...

dialogues.speaker: HEDGE FUND PM
dialogues.text: Because they're in serious trouble. Declining the champagne... 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not in serious trouble. It's a rumor. A woman takes the table next to them and this makes Derivatives Trader perk up and say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Goodyear Tire is definitely a buy. Hedge Fund PM checks out the woman.

dialogues.speaker: HEDGE FUND PM
dialogues.text: Totally. And those tires are real. Even more confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodyear? The chart is horrible.

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE EQUITY CFO
dialogues.text: Somebody color the quant in here. Hedge Fund PM leans into Quant and explains...

dialogues.speaker: HEDGE FUND PM
dialogues.text: Boeing, ticker BA... Big Ass. Goodyear, ticker GT... Great Tits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing...) Oh, it's like a code. And Private Equity CFO turns to Jacob with...

dialogues.speaker: QUANT ANALYST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys were down three points in an up market today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, somebody was adding to their short. As a supermodel now joins the next table.

dialogues.speaker: HEDGE FUND PM DERIVATIVES TRADER
dialogues.text: Going long Starwood. Starwood's a buy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (figuring it out) Starwood, ticker HOT. Yeah but... I'm more a buyer of... (thinks for a minute) GDFS.

dialogues.speaker: PRIVATE EQUITY CFO
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that? 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an exchange traded fund that tracks the Guinian Franc.

dialogues.speaker: HEDGE FUND PM
dialogues.text: Okay, whatever -- what's it code for? And Quant looks over to the model then back proudly with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gold Digger Freak Show. The guys just shake their heads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Derivatives Trader enjoy the summer night. Out all the guys, he's closest to Jacob. His name is Robby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something, Robby? Robby nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean. The amount of money you would need to fuck it all and walk away... if you wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to walk away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. But one day... I don't know. When I have a family. It's just so consuming... so many marriages get

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wall Street divorce lawyers do great in any market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've thought about it. What I would need... to raise a family, live a good life, be secure. It's not as much as we would think if you move out of New York. And it dawns on Robby... 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha... when did you buy the ring? Jacob smiles at his friend's perception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when are you going to ask her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to DC this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I like her for you. She's one of the good ones...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear what her father said on Charlie Rose? Jacob shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something about Bear Stearns being the first rain drop of the impending mother of all storms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sour grapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's speaking at Columbia on Friday. If it's slow enough, a few of us might play hookie and check it out... he's the best show in town. And they continue to walk, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me what you hear. Robby slowly nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you want to hear it, bro. You worship Zabel and it's not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't worship him. He's done a lot for me and I've known him a long time. But he's been acting strange lately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me what you hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That Keller Zabel is holding toxic waste they can't find a market for. 12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob shakes his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not true. It's rumors. There are hedge funds with huge short positions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, you know better. You know it doesn't matter if they're rumors or not. And Robby stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senior year I couldn't get my mind around how all those dot coms with no earnings were worth billions of dollars and you were the one who said something that made it all clear for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember. Turning to Jacob with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "An asset's value can only be priced at its perception."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said that? Robby confirms... then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So buddy -- it don't matter if the rumors are true or not. Because in this climate... if they exist at all... then most likely... Looking his friend head on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you're going to cease to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob leaves his Murray Hill building apartment and nods his doorman, DIEGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: J to the Acob -- morning to you, brother. Jacob smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diego... 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jacob waits for the morning joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what's the best aphrodisiac on Wall Street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jet fuel. Diego cracks up. Jacob just shakes his head and moves on. And Jacob walks uptown... deep in thought. It's a gorgeou June Friday. Suddenly, Jacob just stops walking and stands there for a long moment... coming to a decision. And as Jacob turns around and starts heading the other wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob smiles to the doorman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see Andrew Zabel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he expecting you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator opens and Andrew Zabel appears with two ador Bichon Frise puppies. Jacob stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy. I'm sorry to come by like this but the rumors are now hitting a fever pitch and I wanted to make sure everything was okay. Zabel nods and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter through the gates of the park and walk... 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything okay? And Andrew Zabel doesn't seem all there... introspective blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember when the starter gave me this bushy hair twelve year old kid and I said; "Donny, what the fuck -- give me a real caddy." And he said; "This kid's the best."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you were. You had the wind down, the grade of every green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you wouldn't shut up about stocks. Twelve years old and you blabbed on and on about companies and sectors and earnings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy, are we going under?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that piece of shit you loved? That airline equipment supplier who was branching out into car airbags--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flour Controls. Are you okay? Zabel laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flour Controls... what a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you give me that bonus? Zabel stops walking and faces Jacob with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know you, Jacob. And I know you've been holding off because you didn't think you had enough. We all do that... postpone life until we believe we have what it takes to actually live it. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There isn't a better money-runner on the street... we'll get through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marry her, Jacob. And have children with her and spend as much time as you can with them... and never forget that that's what's important. And Jacob L. Moore... looking his boss head on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew, if there's anyway I can help -- give back the bonus -- whatever... all you have to do is say the word. And Zabel just looks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's just so much you don't know, Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The normally very loud and frenetic place is very quiet a sober today. They all watch Alexis Glick report...

dialogues.speaker: ALEXIS GLICK, (ON THE TVS)
dialogues.text: Rumors of insolvency have hit the street concerning KZI's books and they're shooting first then asking questions later. The stock is now trading just a bit over thirty one dollars a share, down almost forty four percent on the session. And standing in the center of the floor, watching this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stunned... horrified... his universe becoming unglued. And he turns to Audry... helpless and in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did this to us? She can only shrug... tears in her eyes. Jacob shifts his gaze over to the trading floor's electro ticker on the wall... KZI $26.34... -$29.57. And he moves for the elevator banks... unable to take it anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Furious, Jacob walks down 6th ave with his phone to his e 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew, call me back. I'm going to find out who did this to us. I swear to God... if it's the last thing I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to bounce back from this. And we're going to find out who spread the rumor... and then we're going to destroy them. He disconnects the call and keeps walking. After a beat, with his anger brewing... Jacob SLAMS his p down on the ground and it shatters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob lays on his couch vacantly pondering the ceiling. Fox Business plays on the new plasma tv on the wall... footage of THE GOVERNOR OF NEW YORK, a tough looking man his 40s, speaking to the press outside of The State Capit

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anything about the solvency of Keller Zabel. I do know that what's bringing down the stock at this precise moment are rumors. And this practice of short selling American financial institutions then floating rumors in order to profit from them must be stopped. The uptick rule must be reinstated. Jacob glares over to the tv.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR, (FOOTAGE)
dialogues.text: And once again, I will point to largely unregulated world of hedge funds... an ever-growing and increasing powerful area of the market that I repeatedly tried to regulate as Chairman of the SEC... And there's a loud knock on the door. Jacob ignores it.

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR, (FOOTAGE)
dialogues.text: And the collapse of this legendary New York financial institution is why I continue to fight that battle as Governor of this great state. Another knock... this time louder. Jacob mutes the tv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? From the door... 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob... answer the door. Jacob gets up, moves slowly and answers the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't answering your phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It broke. Robby sharply nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude... He stops short... swallows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just found this out and it hasn't hit the press yet. Once again... he stops short and looks away in frustratio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Robby, what are you trying to say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew Zabel threw himself in front of the subway this morning. Jacob just stands in that doorway. No reaction at all. Absolutely frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob now stands in the center of his apartment. Complete in shock. As he looks to the plasma... Fox Business on mu Brian Sullivan reporting under the graphic KZI $19.34... $37.28. He glares at it for a long moment, then... almost calmly picks up a chair and throws it into the tv... which shatt And Jacob... not sure what to do. Until... he turns and sees... on the dresser... a gorgeous engagement ring sitt in an open box... a fuck you ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob bounds the steps of the Business School and head into the old stone building. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lecture hall is packed with wall to wall students. Ja stands at the back. A PROFESSOR is at the podium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our speaker today has quite a checkered background in the world of finance. Some laughter from the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He graduated from City College in 1966 and became a securities broker at Hudson River Bank then moved on to Smith Barney. In 1973 he went out on his own to establish a spectacular career as a independent trader then an active participant in the LBO craze of the 1980s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In 1988, he was indicted for insider trading and then charged with other various forms of securities fraud and IRS violations. In one of the most harshest sentences ever given to a white collar criminal... he served fourteen years in a maximum security prison and he wants me to stress that it was not a country club. Again laughter from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since his release in 2002, he has written and has spoken publicly about what he refers to as the current state of the world economy. He is not allowed to trade on the US exchanges. His new book "Moral Hazard! Why Wall Street Has Finally Gone Too Far." comes out in October.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please welcome... Gordon Gekko! The room applauds... and out to the podium slowly walks..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No swagger in his step... not in a suit... hair not slick back... but still looks fucking good. As he waits for the applause to wind down... and even a little longer... surveying every corner of the large room commanding its full attention... getting it... holding th silence... until finally... he leans into the mic and say 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're all pretty much fucked. The room breaks into laughter... Gordon smiles and waits it to die down.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What's not funny is what's happening out there. I don't think people get it. And I know the financial center of the world doesn't get it... which happens to be Washington DC now. As he takes to a pace...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To understand where we are, we need to understand how we got here. No good deed goes unpunished, all fires start with a well meaning spark and we wanted Americans to be able to afford homes. Sounds nice enough... lets try to get the middle and lower classes into homes they can own. So we made money cheap and lowered restrictions on mortgage lending. As he takes a moment and looks over the room...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Somebody reminded me the other night that I once said "greed is good." I swear I don't remember it but it sounds like something I would say in the Eighties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I was right then. Greed was good. America needed greed and risk-taking and leverage to get to become the superpower we are... or were. And capitalism needed greed and risk and leverage to become the economic platform it has become... but those same attributes that got us there are now the liabilities that threaten to destroy us. Jacob's blackberry vibrates and he checks it. He has a te "KZI!!! -- wtf?"

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So greed has been redefined. Who knows -- maybe it was always like this and like everything else in this world, it's good and it is evil. Taking a moment to survey the room... 20.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because people -- it's greed that caused someone who aspires to own a seven-hundred thousand dollar house they can't afford, to take on a loan they'll never be able to pay back... and it's greed that caused their mortgage lender to give them that loan then sell it right away... and it's greed that caused the buyer of that loan to slice it into a million little pieces then spit them all over the world... and it's greed that caused the rating agency to give that toxic loan a triple-A rating just because it was mixed in with some good loans... and it's greed that caused the insurance company to insure that loan. Jacob quickly glances down again at his blackberry and ch the quote, KZI $14.53.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They were insuring the end of the world; "When the world explodes... just find us in the rubble and we'll be sure to pay your claim." Drawing in a deep breath...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: CMO's, CLO's, CBO's, CDO's, CDS's, SPE's, ABCP's,SIV's, REMIC's, CMBS's, toxic traunches, ninja loans, credit default swaps, affinity marketing, stapled financing, synthetic securitization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I was in prison too long but I have no idea what half that shit means. The room laughs in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I'm considered a pretty smart guy when it comes to finance! And Jacob's blackberry vibrates again. This time he remov it from his pocket, doesn't check it and simply turns it

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And if I know our central bank -- which I do -- I predict it's going to throw gasoline on this fire with more cheap money and federal bailouts and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: statistics on productivity and inflation. And Gordon stops pacing... takes a moment for effect. 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then sums it all up with...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So no good deed goes unpunished and all fires start with a well-meaning spark and when you take free money and no lending standards then add it with unaccountable risk and ungodly leverage and unbridled greed... what you end up with is cancer. And Gordon takes in a deep breath...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Systemic, malignant and global. Now the room is completely silent.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do they still have the V&T restaurant on Amsterdam? Is that still there? A stunned girl in the front row shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (with a smile) God, I loved their pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob looks on as Gordon is surrounded by professors and students alike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (announcing to the throng) I'll give you six minutes then I really have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon quickly walks out with his PUBLISHER, a woman in h 40s and heads into the quad. Jacob immediately matches th stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gekko, can I speak to you for a moment? As he keeps walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too late, Sport... Q&A's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Jacob Moore and I'm dating your daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to ask her to marry me. And this makes Gordon stop and finally face Jacob with... 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll give you nine minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gordon and Jacob leave the campus and take to the stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keller, Zabel? Then you have my apologies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stock's in a free fall. My guess is that it just lost its Bar Mitzvah... Jacob quickly takes out his blackberry, turns it on and checks to see Gordon's right... KZI... $12.54.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: By the end of the day it might not even be potty trained. And Jacob looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I might not be allowed to trade, Jake, but I still love to watch from home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew Zabel took me under his wing when I was in high school. He basically got me my scholarship to Yale then hired me right out of business school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew's smart, he beats the benchmarks consistently. He'll land on his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. And Gordon stops walking and regards Jacob. Who confirms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He killed himself this morning. As that registers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to hear that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a father to me. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Jacob coldly shakes it off then sucks in a deep breat and looks into Gordon's eyes... genuine and lofty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love your daughter very much and I would be honored if... And realizing what this is... Gordon starts to laugh... w throws Jacob off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you would bless-- I really don't understand what you find so funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daughter hasn't spoken to me for eleven years and you know it. She blames me for her brother's overdose and every other disaster that's fallen upon the world since the mid-nineties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And by the way, isn't it strange that Winnie would date a guy from the street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hates me. And she hates Wall Street and everything it represents... so don't you find it curious that she would fall in love with you? And that slams into Jacob... who's frozen for a beat. Jacob finally snaps out of it then joins Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So you want my blessing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I should know a little about you first. Where did you grow up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Matinecock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't like that. I mean we didn't have much money. My mother was a tailor. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your father... what did he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disappear. And Gordon regards Jacob for a long moment, taking him in until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clever. Jacob looks down the street.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your town car. With a laugh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, pal... As Gordon pats Jacob on the back...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... then you're going to be looking for quite awhile. ... and heads for the subway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon takes out his wallet and produces his metrocard. Jacob notices a picture of Winnie in the wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see that? Gordon shrugs and shows the picture to Jacob. It's of a young Winnie and younger Gordon on the back of gorgeous white horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was eight in that one. It was taken in Egypt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I... have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She doesn't keep pictures from her childhood. Gordon slowly nods. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I get in return?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... wanna make a trade? And Gordon thinks about, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'll give you this picture and in return... I'd like a picture of Winnie... taken recently... without you in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have one on me. Gordon sighs, takes the picture out of his wallet and han it to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'll give you this one on margin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they wait for the train... Jacob produces the ring box and opens it to show Gordon t ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really did come to ask for your blessing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you didn't. Nice ring... As the train arrives...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's so typical. (inside of an ironic laugh) Levered to the hilt... and with the ship going down... As he gets on...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... they still gave you a bonus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon stares at a one sheet advertisement on the wall. And he doesn't look at Jacob when he says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play me, Jake. You don't think I can see it in your eyes? You don't think I know that look?

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know it by sight, Kid... because I lived it for years. Christ, I can even smell it on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smell what on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Revenge. Jacob just looks away.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Some hedgehog said bad things about your company. It caused the stock to plummet and made those bad things become true. And Jacob now sees the poster that has Gordon's attention It features a pile of money being blown out the window un the caption that reads... "If this looks familiar to you. it's because you're renting!"

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The man you loved like a father threw himself in front of the uptown five this morning and you want to bring that hedgehog to their knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew he was dead? "Guardian Mortgage... Low down payments... Adjustable rat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said -- I still love to watch from home. And now Gordon turns to face Jacob with...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So don't insult me by pretending to ask for Winnifred's hand when what you really want to know is who to bring down to their knees and how to do it. And Jacob swallows that back... doesn't argue it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was either Nassim Tariq from the Frontier Fund, Bretton Woods from Locust or Karen Molina from ESL. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Winnie even know you came to see me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, not exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm going to tell her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not such a grand idea, Pal. Off Jacob's confusion...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See, I have a feeling you're going to want to see me again. And if you tell her we had this little pow-wow... she's not going to let that happen. As Jacob considers that... the train slows to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look, you seem like a smart kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walk away, dust off your resume and get another job... As he steals one last glance at that Guardian Mortgage ad

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... but do it quick. And with that, Gordon moves for the doors. But Jacob steps in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to bring them down. Whoever floated the rumor for a quick buck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not worth it. It's a waste of energy and time. See, Jacob, nobody gets it... they never did. As the subway doors open...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If there's one thing I learned in prison it's that money is not the prime commodity in our lives... time is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And your nine minutes are up. And Gordon Gekko gets off the subway... leaving Jacob on train. But right before the doors close, Gordon stops and turns with... 28.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There are worse ways to go than jumping in front of a train. For instance, could you imagine taking something for your diabetes... As the doors close...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: .. and end up having it cause you to die of acute pancreatitis? And as the subway pulls out of the station, Jacob Moore j stands there... holding the pole and wondering what the h that was supposed to mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Victorian Estate on a bluff. Zabel's funeral in progres Hundreds of people made it out from the city. All types.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew didn't have children, so he made all you -- all of us -- his children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to list Andrew Zabel's many accomplishments would take me far too long to enumerate, but if you just look around you, you'll see those accomplishments in the faces of the many people gathered here today. And we pan the procession of mourners... past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The alumni of the Morris High School class of 1997... who -- through the adopt a grade program -- Andrew pledged to pay the college educations of every member who graduated and got accepted into a University. ... past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The members of the Saint Helena Symphony, who Andrew provided emergency funding for when they were facing extinction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the many, many, other recipients of Andrew Zabel's generosity. ... and past...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those who were left behind... those who were overlooked... those who otherwise would never have stood a chance. 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we land on Jacob L. Moore...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Above being just a great financial mind... or a great husband... He wears a dark suit... and a blank expression...

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... or a great father... or a great neighbor... or a great friend... ... with nothing but cold retribution in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PRIEST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... Andrew Zabel was a great man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the guests across the pool eat and quietly mill a We're with Jacob, Willy, Audry and another trader named DANIEL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dollars a share?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Fed didn't give us a choice. Jacob walks around the room... taking in the pictures of Andrew Zabel's life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that include the building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the Zabel's institutional managed fund? How much is in that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight billion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's all intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, United Bancorp made out like a bandit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could've handled it at $60 a share or even $50. He just shakes his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was that fucking rumor. It was so well timed. And the market doesn't care... shoot first, ask later. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemmings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: United has a huge trading desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we're all out of a job. Jacob pulls away from the wall of pictures...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother was a tailor. They all look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of our house less than five miles from here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're from Matinecock? I thought you didn't grow up with mon-- Jacob confirms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't rich. Everyone else was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She altered their clothes and I carried their golf clubs. And Jacob looks at a picture of Andrew Zabel one more tim

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gave me a seat at the table. ... and goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob heads for the main house. He sees BARBARA ZABEL, Andrew's wife, sitting next to the some friends. Jacob slowly walks over and when she sees him... she stands... wobbly and full of tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob... Jacob takes her into his embrace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through her sobs) You were a son to him... Squeezing her tight... fighting back a rush of emotion. 31.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was a fucked up kid, I was angry, my mother couldn't control me. He was the only one who cared. I wouldn't be anywhere right now if it wasn't for... And Jacob Moore stops short... finally breaking down... allowing his own tears to stream down his face. He pulls away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you need anything. She nods. And Jacob moves away from the people and moves across the lawn. But he stops when he sees a woman standing across t way... we've seen pictures of her. She's in her late-twenties with a natural beauty that mig take two glances to notice. But after that second glance. it's unforgettable. She's WINNIE GEKKO. As she rushes to him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lehigh had the committee hearings and I knew he would need you and I didn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not how this works. And she looks into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, that's not how this works. He nods. Regards her for a beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you marry me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a ring. Not on me, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you proposing to me at a funeral?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a whole thing I was going to do in DC but seeing you... the words just kind of fell out of my mouth... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would've loved you doing this here. Jacob agrees. And she softly kisses him and squeezes him tight... tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... I'll marry you, Jacob. Hugging her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I don't have a job anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome.

dialogues.speaker: AND THAT FUCK YOU RING
dialogues.text: Glittering in all its glory. Pull back to be in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie looks up from the ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's too expensive. We'll return it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob I don't care about what ring you give me. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not taking it back. I worked hard for that ring and I want you to wear it. She regards him... he's serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He moves to her... takes the ring and places it on her finger. Then Jacob pulls her into his kiss... it's almost violent She's taken off guard. And as they fall into each other then back onto the bed..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole floor is dead. The tvs are off. Jacob cleans out his desk, Audry cleans hers out as well across the way. Jacob wipes his forehead and glances up at the large lett on the wall "Keller, Zabel Investments." And he shakes his head in anger and frustration...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Audry. She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cover pharm and biotech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are the big players in diabetes treatments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lilly, Abbot, OSI, Inverness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is anyone riding on something in phase three?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Few midcaps maybe. You want me to check? He nods. She turns on her computer and takes a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this takes me back to when I had a job... He stands over her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Amlyn pharmaceuticals has Byetta going in front of the FDA next month. I remember this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: they pulled it during phase two because some of the test subjects died but they've obviously solved those problems now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did they die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pancreatitis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. That was it. Jacob shakes his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? Without answering her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you look up large institutional ownership?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mutual or hedge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hedge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locust Fund owns a shitload. And she looks over to Jacob with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bretton Woods. As he takes in that information...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want your severance, Audry? And he kisses her on the forehead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short Amlyn pharmaceuticals. ... and goes. 35.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob peruses the paintings that are going up for auct with Hedge Fund PM.

dialogues.speaker: HEDGE FUND PM
dialogues.text: What the fuck is pancreatitis anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A private gym on Greene street. As Jacob spars with a BLOGGER from streetaccount.com...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know exactly but it's not something you wanna come down with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5000 square feet of space, exposed brick and Minotti furniture. A private wine tasting is being held. About fifteen people look on as the SOMMELIER describes t details of the bottle he's uncorking. Near the back, find Jacob standing with a MORGAN STANLEY PRIVATE CLIENT GROUP PORTFOLIO MANAGER.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN PORTFOLIO MANAGER
dialogues.text: (whispers to Jacob) When's the FDA coming down with their decision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they stand in front of a huge Sigmar Polke...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any day now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While showering Jacob with quick jabs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your information from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding the wine he's supposed to be sampling but not drinking it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doctor that's very close to the trials... and that's all I can say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they move on from the Polke... 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But listen, I'm out of work now so I can't afford to get behind size on this trade... I'm only telling you because you've helped me in the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he removes his head gear and wipes away the sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is completely off the record. So please...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they receive the next glass of wine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... don't tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob gets off the train and sees her across the platform Winnie. And as he brings her into his embrace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob and Winnie have dinner with her boss, SENATOR KATHE LEHIGH, 50's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boy's coming up in the polls. Senator Lehigh nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're blaming this mess on the current administration... it's helping us. And some people say that the worst isn't over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her father. What's the word he uses... systemic. Winnie looks over to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did he say that? And Jacob takes for an extra long moment... holding her look... then comes to a decision and lies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Charlie Rose. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Winnie continues to glare at him... until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) Okay -- so when's the big date?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As New York opens for business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The prevalent pay site for all hedgefunders, trading desk cowboys and large individual players. Looks like a scrapp internet start-up with mismatching cheap office furniture As our blogger from the gym sips his coffee, fires up his computer and starts to type...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small well appointed two-bedroom in Cleveland Heights. Jacob wakes and leans up. He regards Winnie sleeping next him. He softly kisses her neck. She smiles in her sleep then rolls over. As their bodies intertwine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge industrial space in the highline district that hou this eight billion dollar hedge fund. Find a meeting in progress with all of the fund PORTFOLIO MANAGERS. This is known as the weekly idea storm session. where each PM pitches new trade ideas. As Hedge Fund PM stands up to present to the team with a confident smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed for work, Winnie heads into the bedroom and regar Jacob still laying in bed. She kisses him on the forehead, lays a section of The Washington Post on his chest with a little laugh then goe As Jacob looks down to see... it's the classified jobs section.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midtown, corporate, high-floor. Find the private client portfolio manager we remember fro the wine tasting. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits at his computer in a big corner office with a beautiful western view to the river behind him and types an IM window "AMLN short -- FDA to deny Byetta" then hits send. As he receives the digital receipt... "1209 instant messa sent."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob munches toast and watches Fox Business in his underwear...

dialogues.speaker: JENNA LEE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: ... another stock that's getting beaten before the bell is Amlyn Pharmaceuticals. The stock's down nine percent in premarket trading on no news. Jacob smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JENNA LEE, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: When we come back we have Blue star Airlines' CEO Bud Fox discussing how he turned his once small regional airline into the country's third largest carrier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A select group of Financial JOURNALISTS sit in small meta chairs in front of a podium with the Amlyn name and logo behind it. As the INVESTOR RELATIONS OFFICER heads up the podium and opens his prepared statement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob watches "Happy Hour" on Fox Business as Winnie open bottle of wine in the kitchen. She pours a glass of wine another of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he wins... she has a real chance for a cabinet position and I'm pretty sure she'll take me with her if she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to win. As she hands him the glass of water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't jinx it. And Jacob sees Amlyn Pharmaceuticals graphic on the scree and turns up the tv. 39.

dialogues.speaker: ERIC BOLLING, (ON THE TV)
dialogues.text: Big drop in Amlyn as negative rumors on the street forced the company to admit there are still internal concerns about Byetta and pancreatitis. They now may be forced to pull the phase three drug from FDA review and retool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stock takes a twenty-eight percent haircut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we watch something else? Jacob brings her in and kisses her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want. Her phone rings. As she goes to answer it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Project Runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not Project Runway. Picking up the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... who is this? Hold on. As she pulls the phone away from her ear and looks over t Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for you... someone named Bretton Woods?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob rounds West 62nd street and stares down the hottest address in Manhattan. A little nervous, he sucks in a dee breath then heads into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BUTLER lets Jacob in. Jacob takes in the massive space with an insane view of Central Park. He can hear a beauti sonata playing in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see Bretton Woods. The butler nods then leads Jacob through the full floor u and into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge chandelier hangs over the all marble room. A fireplace on one wall and a twelve foot wall of glass featuring that park view on the other. And Jacob realizes that sonata is live. He's walked into recital of some sort. About twenty people sit watching a YOUNG GIRL play on a v unique looking silver grand piano. The girl can't be a day over thirteen. She's playing Mozart's "Ronda Alla Turca"... her fingers gliding across keyboard in precision, her eyes closed in inspiration. It as spectacular as it is moving. Jacob takes it in for a moment then looks over the room. ethnicities and types... The AFRICAN LEADER in full tribal gear, the DISHEVELED AR with his GAY NOVELIST LOVER, the NEW YORK KNICK with his MODEL WIFE, the MOVIE STAR with her TEENAGE SON. And BRETTON WOODS... Mid 40s, slicing jawline, deep set eyes, in great shape, refined, composed and masculine. He's the owner of this penthouse and he's looking right a Jacob. Jacob looks away. And the young girl finishes the last movement of the sona to applause. The guests all stand, some go talk with the girl. Bretton heads over to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you can see, I'm having a little dinner party here but I thought it was important we speak right away. He speaks with a British accent.. Jacob nods. Bretton looks over the room for a moment, scans his guest then back at Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please... if you don't mind waiting in my office, I'll be in a minute. And the butler is already at Jacob's side, motioning him follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob waits for Bretton. He looks over the place. The vie of the park. The classic furniture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of a giant man-like monster eating a much smaller naked human. The smaller man's head's been bitten off and blood drips down the body. Jacob holds on the painting.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Saturno devorando a sus hijos. As Jacob turns to see Bretton standing in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Saturn devouring his son. Francisco Goya. Bretton heads in and closes the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you collect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Sitting behind his desk...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Only the obsessive compulsive or the insecure egotistical feel the need to collect things. Jacob nods. Bretton just looks at him... making him nervo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter's an amazing piano player. That was quite a show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't my daughter. That was Isabel Patrovsky, she's the world's greatest living piano prodigy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that wasn't a show... that was a very expensive private recital. There's a long beat of silence with Jacob just looking at Bretton... taking him in. And it's unmistakable -- the one thing that this man exud above all else... is composure.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You cost my fund three hundred and forty million dollars today. Off of Jacob's slight smile...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yeah, kills my year, pushes my watermark higher and might cause redemptions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you're happy. My fund's in trouble now. Jacob just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don't want to deny it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who told you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A doctor I know. Bretton nods... regards him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I checked with all the desks in town... you didn't make money off it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You destroyed my firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your firm destroyed itself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed Andrew Zabel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew Zabel killed himself. And Bretton sighs...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The rumors were true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made them true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jacob, being levered thirty-eight to one in toxic debt made them true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Institutional money-running was Zabel's talent... he didn't have a down year in the last twenty. Jacob just glares at him. 43.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: His fatal flaw was allowing the children on his mortgage security desk to talk him into the deadly game of hot potato everybody's been so fond of playing recently. And Jacob holds Bretton's look for a moment, then... head for the door without saying a thing...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come work for me. Jacob stops and turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I run three billion dollars. Come help me run it. And Jacob takes a beat... processing this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because your loyalty desired revenge, your balls actually attempted it and your skills pulled it off. As he stands...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And as for Andrew Zabel... there really is no telling why he did what he did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As far as I'm concerned, it was just a bit of money... and there are surely more important things in the world. And Jacob sucks in a deep breath -- containing his anger.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now I'm going on Safari with my family. Think about the offer and get in touch after the July 4th holiday. ... heading for the door...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got my attention, Jacob... and that's one of the rarest commodities out there. And Jacob just regards him, then... 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can have my answer now, Bretton... I have no interest in working for a fund that's in trouble. Bretton smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touche. Jacob nods... holding Bretton's look. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The amount of money you would need to be able to walk away from it all and just live happily-ever-after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody has one -- it's an exact number -- what's yours? And Bretton takes a moment to think about that, then simp says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More. ... and disappears into his penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob heads out of his building to be greeted by...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I overheard a guy say yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're going to tell me... Diego smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "This market's just like a divorce. I've lost half my money... only I still have my wife!" As he goes into the hot summer day...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad... 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob heads up to the restaurant to find Gordon Gekko wai outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes she said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not okay. Because it means they're crowded so every tier in the service chain will be extended. The sixteen minutes we would normally wait to order will now be twenty six, the standard twenty four minutes waiting for our food to arrive will turn into thirty nine, the eight minutes to get the check will become seventeen and the four minutes to process the credit card will take nine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you I'd have lunch with you... not give you a hundred and six minutes of my time. Jacob just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's go to Whole Foods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon and Jacob share a little table out front of the ma Gordon enjoys a turkey burger from the deli while Jacob d eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you eat before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just not hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... I used to not eat lunch too. Jacob nods and slides something across the table. The picture of Winnie in workout gear, flipping the finger. Gordon looks at it and laughs. 46.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fitting. As he places it in his pocket...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That'll make it a round trade for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I actually owe you one now. Off Gordon's look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I crushed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His fund is bleeding. I wouldn't be surprised if the redemptions finish the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Chief... you seem awfully proud of yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you know about Amlyn? Gordon shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's amazing what information you can find out when people know you're not going to trade on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you didn't use me to make a little money? And never to look up from his lunch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw. I prefer to write about the action now than be apart of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you give it to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of a job and most likely going to marry my daughter... I figured you could use the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't make any money off of it. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't trade it? With a smile in and over-the-top faux innocence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would've been insider trading, Mr. Gekko. Gordon just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And not "most likely."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie and I are engaged. As Gordon finally looks up from his burger... impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk up Park Avenue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did you take my advice and not tell your new fiance about our little friendship. Jacob doesn't say anything. And Gordon doesn't press.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, I'm guessing she's not going to take your last name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my Winnie. I knew she was a feminist when she was five and furious that Mrs. Claus didn't get enough credit. And this makes Jacob smile... then...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: My brother has two daughters. I had Winnie and Rudy. (sucking in a deep breath) And since Rudy... you know... well, I've worried about the name. It's something you don't really think about until you hit sixty or so but it's important. As they walk some more in silence, until...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want you to get my daughter to accept me back into her life again, Jacob. 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob slowly nods... not surprised.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because save for the extremely precious and depreciating asset of time... she's all I have. As Gordon stops in front of a Georgian-style, pre-war building and turns to Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon, I'll show you some more pictures of your fiancee that she doesn't want you to see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon and Jacob get into the elevator, Gordon pushes "4. The doors begin to close but someone gets on at the last moment. He's a hedge fund type, real SLICK, reminds us of Gekko twenty years ago. Oh... and he's about 29 years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon... Gekko nods. Slick hits his floor... "PH."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sky still falling?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inside of a derisive sigh) Sells books I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No doubt about it, this is a nice place. Worth three mill dollars, maybe four at the beginning of the year. Sparsely decorated. Large framed photographs line the wal Gordon shows Jacob pictures of Winnie's childhood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She refused to take that cowboy hat off. She actually slept in it. Smitten, Jacob looks at some more of the pictures then stands... taking in the large framed pictures on the wall As Jacob checks out a framed chart for "Gouda Tulip Bulbs 1 1634 to Feb 5 1637." The chart goes straight up and to right then straight down in a single line. 49.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tulip mania... the art of a bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bretton offered to hire me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And did you accept? As Jacob moves over to an another piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck no. Jacob now finds himself looking at a political cartoon fr the early 1900s. It's of two men rowing a boat in a lake of dollars. One o the men is Uncle Sam dressed in US flag colors. But Sam's very small in this cartoon... can't really row the boat. The other man is much bigger and clearly doing the heavy rowing. He is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JP Morgan... he single-handedly stopped the Panic of 1907 by stepping in and buying up shares in all the companies that were crashing. Everyone else quickly followed like lemmings. (re political cartoon) See -- people had stopped looking to their government or trusted advisors. They looked to JP Morgan. It was all about simple psychology -- every crash should have a JP Morgan to step in and save it. As they walk the hardwood floor...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See Jacob... the best opportunities are found where angels fear to tread. And they arrive at the next piece on the wall... a small framed bond.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That's a bond issued by the Central American country of Poyais. Gregor McGregor made a fortune dealing these to the British elite in 1820.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The country didn't exist. And now Jacob notices a very strange picture across the room... he goes over to look at it. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very old... black and white... of a woman filling he stove with money.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Weimer Republic of Germany 1922. Inflation turned to hyper-inflation and it was more efficient to burn the money for heat than spend it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's horrifying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. As they both hold on the picture...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What caused it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A country in debt... that took on even more debt to fund a war... then printed mountains of money to avoid a depression and other financial imbalances... As he turns to face Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... sound familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you honestly think this is where we're heading? Looking Jacob head on... deadly serious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we don't take our heads out of the sand... yes. It's going to get bad out there, Champ, I'm not going to lie. Even the small regional bank I started out at might go under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudson River Bank...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. And then...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I've got some news for you... he ain't bleeding. He's not even cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I'm talking about, Jake... is that I'd bet dollars to donuts that Bretton Woods unwound most of his position in Amlyn last week. That he knew about the pancreatitis. Off of Jacob's confusion...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The only reason you think you hurt him is because he wanted you to think that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. But it's not Bretton's first rodeo... and my instincts for this sort of thing don't often disappoint. Jacob can't believe it. And with each passing moment of realization... shock turns into rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it, Princess... he's beating your ass all over the court. As Jacob tries to calm himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think I should take the job -- bring him down from the inside? Gordon confirms that with a simple shake of the head and.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Jake... what you kids think is pay-back these days is really incredible. When I was coming up, we slaughtered men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are guys still working at penny ante brokerages in the Poughkeepsie's of this country because they crossed me. While Jacob processes that...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I'll make you another trade, Jake. I'll help you bring him down, if you help me get her back. As Jacob just looks away... non committal. 52.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... then you both can have a father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob walks... on the phone with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, I could lose my job. ... who holds his sleeping infant in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
