dialogues.text: Robby, I need to know. Now nobody moves size in this town without using your desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll play twenty questions only it'll be two questions and all you have to do is say "yes or no." Capitulating with a sigh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bretton Woods... The Locust Fund... did they make any major moves in the last few weeks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it unloading Amlyn pharmaceuticals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robby, I got you the fucking the job! And after a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Jacob stops walking... sucks in a deep breath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to make you do that. With that, he disconnects and shakes his head in frustrat And after a moment, Jacob sucks in a deep breath then mak another call. 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Okay Gordon... you've got yourself a trade.

dialogues.speaker: AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART
dialogues.text: As a circle forms on June 19th then travels down the tren line to early July and stops. And as a circle is formed around July 4th, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exploding over the Capitol building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BBQ for the political set and their families. Paper pla and plastic cups are being thrown away by HELP Children a parents lay on blankets watching the fireworks. Jacob holds Winnie as they look up at the sky...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents would always throw this huge party in the Hamptons on the fourth. The city of South Hampton would have its firework show at 8pm then my father would wait until it was over then put on his... which, of course, was always twice as spectacular. She leans up, sips her wine, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then one year the city passed an ordinance that their firework show had to be the last of the night... they were sick of getting shown up by Gordon Gekko. Jacob laughs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rented a barge and shot the fireworks off of it a mile off the coast... out of jurisdiction. (then... almost to herself) The show was even more amazing over the water. And Jacob looks at her. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he should be invited to the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie, he's your father... As the fireworks explode into their finale...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know he's unhappy. Look at him out there... trying to scare everybody. He's desperate for attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is none of your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "That's not how this works." Remember? She just looks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got nothing. The firework show ends and everyone applauds...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's what he deserves. Suddenly, everyone begins to look over to the house where something is happening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The things that came out after he was convicted. The affairs... the things he was recorded saying... SECRET SERVICE PERSONNEL, wearing ear pieces, start walki the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This wasn't the man we knew, Jacob. It was... sociopathic. She stands up and looks across the lawn to where all the action is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a long time ago. He stands and kisses her... 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just consider it, okay? That's all I'm asking. She holds his look for a long moment, then... nodding ove all the excitement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, you can meet the next President of the United States.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive foyer of black marble with wall to wall views o Manhattan. There's much more space than furniture here. Jacob waits patiently in a white suede chair... he checks watch and sighs. He's been sitting here quite awhile. Finally, the SIX FOOT TALL RECEPTIONIST, leaves her desk. her heels clicking as she walks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob... are you ready? Jacob stands and she leads him toward a bank of elevators The doors open and Jacob gets on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob stands there with Six Foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have everything they said you'd need? Jacob nods... holding a folder of his previous tax forms, passport and other documents obviously needed for the job And the elevator doors open... but not to an office... Jacob shields his eyes to the wash of daylight... then lo to realize that he's on the roof of the building. And in front of him is... An Augusta A109E Helicopter wit "The Locust Fund" written on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob looks down to the city below, wondering where th hell they're going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob emerges from the Augusta and looks across the tarma see a Boeing 727 with "The Locust Fund" written on the si And now Jacob knows why he needed his passport. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the 727 dives down toward Biggin Hill airfield... the lights of London twinkling to the north.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Black Maybach limousine pulls up out front of a 19,00 square-foot Victorian home with the perfectly restored br exterior. As Jacob gets out of the car and sizes down this incredib home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The design is much different that Woods's New York CPW penthouse. It's more classical... with dark woods and wor leathers and thick rugs and commanding views along the Ri Thames. And Jacob is lead into the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Bretton eats alone at the head of the long table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob. As Jacob walks through the expansive space...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Woods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Call me...) Bretton. ... and sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Bretton. I thought we were going to meet in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I thought you had no interest in working for a fund that was in trouble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was emotional. I was angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what changed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I caught a glance of my portfolio. 57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Bretton laughs. Jacob notices two huge chocolate brown French Mastiffs sitting at Bretton's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cute dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dogue de Bordeaux... bred to kill. But Contango and Backwardation here are socialized since birth so they're harmless. Jacob laughs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You named your dogs after technical futures market terms? And Bretton stands...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not... (with a wink) My children did. As he heads into...

dialogues.speaker: THE LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: A fire burning in the fireplace. Jacob follows Bretton in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where are your children? Bretton moves toward a table with a classic phonograph pl on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greece with my wife. My boys are studying The Iliad now. While Bretton looks through the various sleeves of record Contango and Backwardation slowly find their way into the room and sit by the fire. Bretton finds what he's looking for... removing the recor from its sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here it is... one of the most beautiful pieces of music you'll ever hear. Bretton places the record on the phonograph and The Rolli Stones "Let It Loose" rings out... 58.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: "Exile On Main Street," without a doubt The Stones greatest album. Jacob laughs. He was expecting Beethoven.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It was all outtakes. Throwaway tracks. And the critics hated it. And it didn't sell well at first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now it's universally known as their best release. I asked Mick once how he thought that happened. How something could go from so worthless to so valuable. He just looked at me and said... "it never went from worthless to valuable... just the opinions of it did." Taking a seat...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And that was the greatest lesson I ever learned about investing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An asset's value can only be priced at its perception.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. There is no intrinsic. Then... simply...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll work out of the New York office. I wouldn't want to pull you away from your fiancee in Washington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's Gordon Gekko's daughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a legend at one time. It's quite sad how he publicly cries out wolf now. Bretton stands and stretches.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You see, for a legend... 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside of a tired sigh...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... the only thing worse than death is becoming irrelevant. And Bretton just sits there... enjoying his scotch while taking in the Stones tune...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob stands at the window of his suite... looking out on the Victoria embankment and on the phone with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good work, kid -- you're on the inside now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to Dubai to raise some money then meeting me in New York to set me up. Gordon sits at the dining room table at his apartment. Papers scattered about and his EDITOR waiting patiently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not meeting you in New York.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you need to go to Dubai with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the 727 takes off ...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You need to do something that will earn his trust... you need to make yourself a hero...

dialogues.speaker: INT. 727
dialogues.text: Jacob sits across from Bretton who enjoys a slice of Pizz and a Coke. 60.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Jacob... you need to help him get this money. And Jacob glares at Bretton like he might kill him.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But be cautious. Your relationship with Bretton is still fragile -- you fuck it up here and you're done. Bretton looks up and Jacob immediately replaces his glare with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks better than meals I get on United.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's Pizza on Bleeker. It crossed the Atlantic with you yesterday. Would you like a slice? Jacob declines... then...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I appreciate you wanting to help with this part of the business even though it's not your expertise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- there's a lot I can learn from you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For this trip just stay in the background and observe. As Bretton tosses some pizza to Contango and Backwardatio

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're going to meet with Oleg Bakunin. He's a Russian oligarch on the run because Putin wanted to steal everything he owns. He already has a few hundred million with us but I'm looking to get half a billion more. Our maintenance fee on that alone would be ten million a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father didn't make half of that in his twenty-six year career. And he looks out the window...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He worked in a mid-level job for United Bancorp actually... 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never to look from the window... with just a trace of disdain...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got a fishing kit when he retired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most bizarre, stunning city in the world -- outlandis skyscrapers, marinas, archipelagos... And the 727 is now flying over...

dialogues.speaker: THE WORLD OF ISLANDS
dialogues.text: A collection of man-made islands that make out a one- dimensional map-like depiction of Earth. As we fly over this archipelago...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Richard Branson purchased Great Britain, Rod Stewart bought Germany, Tommy Lee bought Greece.

dialogues.speaker: BECKER JETVAN LUXURY COACH
dialogues.text: It's custom outfitted Mercedes-Benz van that's completely decked out like the inside of a private jet. Full entertainment system, recessed LED lighting, tray tables, fine leather, blacked out windows that "defog" with the p of a button, designed by Phillipe Starck and made custom $450,000 (once you get to the top of the waiting list.) Jacob and Bretton ride into the city. Bretton takes a cal on his Vertu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes... you have to be kidding me. He disconnects the call with a mischievous smile and turn Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Looks like a bit of news broke while we were in the air... And Bretton turns on Fox Business to see footage of... Th Governor of New York standing at a podium next to his WIF He doesn't look happy as he says...

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR, (ON THE TV)
dialogues.text: The remorse I feel will always be with me. Words cannot describe how grateful I am for the love and compassion they have shown me. From those to whom much is given, much is expected.. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob's confused... Bretton's enjoying every second of this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been after us for years...

dialogues.speaker: GOVERNOR, (ON THE TV)
dialogues.text: I have been given much -- the love of my family, the faith and trust of the people of New York, and the chance to lead this state Laughing with delight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jacob... you don't want to live in a glass house if you're gonna play this game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand. Is he resigning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd he do? And Bretton simply turns to him and says...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outsourced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1,000-foot-tall feat of modern design, perched on the edg the Persian Gulf. As the Jetvan pulls out front...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: There's a big party for Oleg tonight at a club called The Left Bank. It's Roaring 20s themed so I've had original suits from that era delivered to our rooms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob and Bretton walk through the ridiculously opulen lobby plated in gold leaf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember. Hedge funds are not banking and this isn't Ivy-league-geography- ninth-hole deal making. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk down the hall to their suites... Contango an Backwardation tagging along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oleg's a brute, he's has A.D.D. and he likes to party. As they stop in front of large double doors... the BELLMA opens the doors to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: THE BURJ AL ARAB PREMIERE SUITE
dialogues.text: Makes the Rainman Suite at Caesar's look like a standard at a Motel 6. 7000 square feet, 360 degree view, 70 inch plasmas share the walls with Picassos and Monets. Bretton nods over to the double doors across the hall...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm just down the hall. (with a smile) I hope you don't mind I took the nicer one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now dressed in a tightly-fitting suit over a white shirt wing collars and stove-pipe skinny trousers, Jacob stands front of the mirror. As Jacob throws on a top hat and admires the 1928 version himself....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Roaring 20's party is taking place... it's full-on speakeasy vibe. It's right out of 1928, only with Europea Russians and Middle-Easterners. Smoke fills the room. A jazz band roars. Drinks flow. As Jacob and Bretton head in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he offers you a drink -- take it. And with that, Bretton points across the room where OLEG BAKUNIN sits.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If he offers you a line of coke -- snort it. He's in his mid-40s, overweight, sweaty, draped in tight black Prada and smoking a cigarette. 64.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If he offers you a child -- raise it. And it seems A MODEL BOMB has recently exploded at Oleg's table... leaving the skinny shards everywhere. Oleg sees them, stands and opens his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bretton Woods has arrived. Bretton smiles. They head over. Oleg turns to one of the MODEL GIRLS next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to meet one of the only men in the world who might be as rich as I am. Wait a minute... Bretton what did oil close at today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred and twenty-nine dollars a barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Model Girl) Forget what I said -- I'm much richer than him. Oleg then looks at Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oleg, I'm Jacob Moore. It's nice to meet you. Oleg regards Jacob for a beat, then back to Bretton and a again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this? Bretton smiles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob has recently come over from KZI to work with me. And now Oleg turns to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KZI? You worked with Andrew Zabel? Jacob takes a beat. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a legend. Jacob just nods, not showing any emotion. Oleg motions fo the girls to make room and they all sit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was that mortgage shit. He should've just focused on managing money and not fuck around with that crazy mortgage shit. Bretton just looks away. Jacob stays cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a shame his fund was only for institutions... I would've liked to have invested. Oleg motions to a WAITRESS who immediately pours vintage champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In honor of the theme tonight, have a glass of 1927 Heidsiek champagne... Oleg hands Jacob a flute before he can decline.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one of two hundred bottles discovered on a shipwreck off the coast of Finland... thirty grand a bottle. And Oleg aggressively puts his arm around Jacob, bringing into a drunken half-bear hug and spilling most of the champagne out of Jacob's flute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oleg and some of his crew lead Jacob, Bretton and three beautiful, giggling model girls down a trail to a seclude mooring. Fishing boats bob violently in the water -- and next to t is Oleg's Phoenix 1000, his personal, 65-meter SUBMARINE. As a boatman helps them all climb aboard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phoenix 1000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk through the ornate deck saloon: Oleg beckons Jasper toward a huge panoramic window lookin out at the city of Dubai. 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then the view starts to MOVE. The surface of the wate RISES before them, Dubai recedes and the submarine descen spectacularly into the depths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5000 square feet, 30 days of oxygen capacity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights illuminate the dark waters as curious fish flit pa Jacob, Bretton and Oleg are on divans, the girls undulati around them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bretton, I have... what?... two hundred million with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And hopefully that's just a start. Oleg, there are so many opportunities out there right now I feel like a kid in the candy store. Oleg waves him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I like to spread it around... I'm like my own fund of funds. I don't like to have too much with one manager. As Oleg shakes cocaine out of an envelope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never really know who to trust in this world. Jacob takes a beat, swallows nervously, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't agree more, Oleg. It's one of the first things that Andrew Zabel taught me. I worked very closely with him. It's why Bretton hired me. To get behind the Andrew Zabel curtain. Bretton flashes Jacob a look... "What the hell are you doing?" Jacob swallows back some nerves then continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said before that you always wanted to invest with Zabel but couldn't because he only handled institutional money. Well here's your chance. Zabel taught me everything he knew. Oleg looks up to Jacob from the line of coke with interes 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm not going to give you the whole cake, Oleg... He looks over to Bretton who still glares at Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can give you a little bite...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It involves building positions in high yielding stocks new to volatility then writing calls with split strike prices. And Oleg regards Jacob for a long moment, a jury determin the verdict... Jacob holding on to that sly smile... Bret looking away... playing it cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's complicated but like Bretton said -- right now there are more opportunities than ever. Oleg simply nods... with a simple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting. ... then does another line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob sleeps. There's a knock on his door. He stirs. The knock's louder. Then... Jacob finally wakes, moves to the door and opens it to see... TWO BEAUTIFUL RUSSIAN WOMEN, PAULINA and NADIA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here for the party. Confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oleg said you needed a party... Cozying up to her friend with a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and we're it. Jacob nervously thinks, then... 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We pan across the suite... past the roaring fire...

dialogues.speaker: PAULINA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Right there... ? ... past the empty bottle of champagne...

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No... not there...

dialogues.speaker: NADIA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: How about there? I bet you want me to do it there. ... past the plate of half-eaten chocolate strawberries..

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: No... I want you to hold it. And find the three of them...

dialogues.speaker: NADIA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: But it's gone up so much. ... sitting at Jacob's computer... looking over a chart f Russian oil company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know... but if you're going to correctly utilize this technical head and shoulders strategy, you need to hold the stock until... (pointing on the chart) ... right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always sell too soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very common mistake. You need to cut your losers short and let your winners run. She looks to her friend with a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good advice for everything... no? Her friend agrees with a laugh. And Jacob checks the cloc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I think enough time has passed. I appreciate you guys keeping our little secret. 69.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he walks them to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must love her very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. Jacob opens the door to let them go but he hears a door o across the hall... Bretton's. And they all witness a YOUNGER AMERICAN WOMAN leave Brett room then head down the hall right by them. Jacob's stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The most famous hooker in the world. Off Jacob's confusion...

dialogues.speaker: THE YOUNGER AMERICAN WOMAN
dialogues.text: that had just left Bretton's room looks right at us under caption "The Governor's $5000 Mistake" Pull back to be on Perezhilton.com Jacob Moore sits in front of his computer. And he turns t Paulina.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she a gift from Oleg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She's Bretton's go-to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He flies her in wherever he's at. And Jacob slowly takes that in... absolutely floored.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing sunglasses, Jacob greets Bretton at the elevators

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look like crap. They walk for the exit.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me ask you something... was that speech about split strike prices and stocks new to volatility for real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Bretton. That was all bullshit. 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bretton smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it worked. Oleg's wiring us five hundred million dollars today. And Bretton turns to Jacob... impressed.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Good job, Jacob... And as they head out into the Dubai heat...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So he trust you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The iconic charging bull of Wall Street.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think so. Travel the park to find... Jacob and Gordon stopping at t food vendors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm happy to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about your end of the trade, Sport?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... I'm still working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to her. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take a pretzel. As they get their food and walk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're a hedge fund cowboy now? Shaking his head...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goddamn hedge funds -- what a racket. Playing the world casino, betting other people's money with leverage. And it's completely legal and completely unregulated.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The hustles they get away with make insider trading seem like a parking ticket.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM INTO THE FRONTIER FUND/TRADING PIT
dialogues.text: Rows and rows of computers in a large dark room....

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nassim Tariq and his Frontier Fund. With their slews of MIT grads who become glorified millionaire robots pushing buttons... ... with casually dressed ASIANS and INDIANS in their 20s working the keyboards like zombies.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... slaves to top-secret propriety elegant algorithms that work until they don't.

dialogues.speaker: AND SLAM INTO ESSEX CAPITAL ADVISERS/CONFERENCE ROOM
dialogues.text: A stuffy conference room half-filled with bored MEN in th 40s watching a presentation...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Or the baby cub funds like Sammy Rosen's Essex Advisers... filled with Goldman Sachs and Julian Robertson pedigree. Most of the men type on their blackberrys... one is actua asleep.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Men who are way too rich, lazy and tired to run money properly anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small cluttered office with papers strewn about...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Or Allan Daniel's and his bully operation. ALLAN DANIELS, a small bull-dog of a man, paces back and forth... dictating in anger. His SECRETARY types down eve word he's shouting.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... with his angry letters to company boards that are nothing but veiled threats in the name of activism.

dialogues.speaker: AND RIGHT BACK TO BOWLING GREEN PARK
dialogues.text: Where Gordon stops walking... 72.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So you're inside... you have his trust... and now you want to know what's next. And Jacob's look over to Gekko confirms this.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Here's the thing about Bretton. He puts all of his money into his own fund which makes him stupid, egotistical, and most importantly... vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he chases. He doesn't take losses well and he chases with leverage. He thinks he's a trader, he thinks he's an investor but he's not. He's a gambler. Regarding Jacob...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That pretzel looks good. Jacob just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Care to make a trade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever. And they trade. The hotdog for the pretzel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As for your end of our trade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find a way for me to reunite with my daughter, Jake. Because we both know how she would react to the fact that you've been lying to her about bonding with your future father-in-law. Just standing there... holding that hot dog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that a threat? Looking Jacob dead on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely. Jacob just shakes his head with a laugh... now realizing Gekko talked him into this position for this exact levera

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're priceless, Gordon. 73.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just be happy I'm on your team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him into a bad position and watch him chase it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What bad position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have I been saying all along, Kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Financials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a death trap -- mark my words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob takes in his new view... it's spectacular.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But he won't fall for a brokerage or bank play this late in the game. Everyone knows they're poison.

dialogues.speaker: AND TIME LAPSE
dialogues.text: As the office grows furniture... a plasma on the wall... a computer on the desk...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sell him on insurance. There's a case to be made for those stocks... ill- fated as they may be. ... books on the shelves... pictures on the walls... a couch and table... a paper shredder and waste baskets..

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But take your time... make him think you've been doing your due diligence. Find Jacob at his desk... working away at his computer... it's late at night.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Make it look like you're working your ass off to find him this genius trade... come in early, leave late and don't bring up the idea for at least a few weeks. And Jacob finally gets up from his desk... goes to the window... looking across midtown Manhattan... 74.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And then Jacob... ... eyes pasted on a building made of glass and steel... building he once called home...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... sell him hard... then watch him bite... then watch him chase... ... KZI Investments.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... then watch him come undone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding his suitcase, Jacob emerges from the elevator and heads for a waiting town car. Jacob sees Diego...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring it. Diego smiles... loves this new one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the most dangerous question on Wall Street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "How are you?" And Jacob agrees whole-heartedly as he heads on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sun rises over our nation's capital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie and Jacob jog the park through the humid July haze It's very early. And Jacob stops jogging. Catches his breath. She keeps running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you with me? She stops and turns back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? 75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hate finance. You hate Wall Street. Why are you with me? Winnie nods. It's a valid question. And she thinks about for a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repetition compulsion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Freud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what does it mean, psych major?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's when people repeat the same dysfunctional relationships from childhood in their adult life in hopes of trying to master them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like when children of alcoholics fall in love with alcoholics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He turns away... upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great, Winnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, that might be why I was initially attracted to you... but it's not why I love you. She moves to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you because you're compassionate and you care so deeply about what you do and you have like no ego, it's crazy. She reaches to him... turning his face to meet hers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're the smartest person I've ever met... and there's nobody I trust more in the world. Jacob looks away... almost ashamed. And Winnie can sense something's not right. 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... As Jacob draws in a deep breath, collects himself and fin turns back to her with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wish you would master that relationship from childhood so you can move forward with this one.

dialogues.speaker: AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART
dialogues.text: As a circle forms on July 20th then travels down the tren and stops. And as a circle is formed around August 11th, we...

dialogues.speaker: EXT. WESTSIDE HIGHWAY- DAY
dialogues.text: And Manhattan... as it sweats through the heart of summer Two jetvans ride uptown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob rides with Bretton...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bretton... I found something I like. Bretton looks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been wondering when my new portfolio manager was going to come to me with something special.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to make sure I would be bringing you the smartest idea possible. I know you don't go light. Confirming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. If I commit to this... we go large and we don't back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It might be better to do this in the office. I have color and support to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waving him off... 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon Jacob, you know that's not how we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2.7 million acres of State protected majestic land. All nature... rivers and lakes... cypresses and maples. Clean air. And trails. Many trails that go on for miles. As the two Becker jetvans arrive at a restricted area, a STATE RANGER opens the gate and allows them to drive thro then park. Jacob and Bretton emerge from the jetvan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is how we do. And with a nod, the DRIVER of the other jetvan opens it t reveal two motorcycles inside. Bretton's MTT Turbine Superbike and an Agusta, these bikes are handcrafted work art as much as they are demons of speed. Jacob laughs in disbelief and excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're allowed to ride these through here? Sucking in the fresh summer air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: AND JACOB AND BRETTON
dialogues.text: Now decked out in leather riding gear... on the bikes... the mouth of the trail... revving the engines...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Follow me... And with that, shoots into the forest. Jacob quickly follows.

dialogues.speaker: AND THEY RIDE
dialogues.text: Winding through the trees... along the side of a river... Bretton riding extremely fast with Jacob trying to keep u Bretton reaches a clearing and waits for Jacob to catch u Once he does...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're going to have to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'm just getting used to it. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me your idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you still short any of the financials?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. After KZI, I took profits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's time to go the other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Banks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurance companies. I'm talking the old school insurers that have become the babies thrown out with the bath water. Jacob waits for a reaction from Bretton. But all he gets is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep up! And with that, Bretton rips into the clearing. Jacob ride just as fast. They're neck and neck... it's definitely a race. Bretton pulls ahead but Jacob doesn't give up. As they move quickly toward a patch of forest with a only narrow trail entering it, Jacob focuses on the horizon an revs the bike into more speed. He pulls up next to Bretto as they approach the trail. If Jacob doesn't slow down, and fall in line behind Brett he's going to hit the trees. But he doesn't. Instead, Jacob blasts the bike into its final dose of spe narrowly avoiding impact by zipping into the trail... pul ahead of Bretton and taking the lead.

dialogues.speaker: A TRANQUIL LAKE
dialogues.text: As it sits still in the setting sun. Untouched by man. Bretton and Jacob get off the bikes and walk to the shore As they catch their breaths and enjoy the beauty... 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The basket of stocks I'm putting together focuses on reinsurance brokering and management services for businesses. They're trading below book and have large dividends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we buy them here. Bretton thinks about it. He's not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Financials are a falling knife. Jacob nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not arguing that... but the best opportunities are found where angels fear to tread. Jacob can see... he has Bretton on the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So yeah -- they are falling knives. But Bretton... And with confidence... driving it home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... what's life without a little blood on your hands?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As WORKERS install an electronic ticker that wraps around top circumference of the whole office... similar to the o Andrew Zabel had.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay. Then I want you to build positions in your favorite three names. Jacob picks up the phone and...

dialogues.speaker: THE SCREEN SPLITS IN TWO
dialogues.text: With Jacob on top and Robby on the bottom. As Robby takes the order and starts typing into his Bloomberg...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I want you stealth. Use all six trading desks we're in business with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six different trading desks... six different BROKERS taki calls from Jacob who still owns the whole top half of the screen.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And if they go down... we increase our size.

dialogues.speaker: AND BACK TO JACOB
dialogues.text: Leaning back... feet on desk... staring at the ticker... which only has three stocks on it...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: See Jacob -- I don't believe in "wrong." MCC at $21.65, ACN at $16.24 and ISS at $7.23.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I only believe in "not right yet."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rainstorm takes over the city. A cab pulls out front of Shun Lee Cafe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie sucks in a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He chose this restaurant. Jacob confirms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used to come here every Sunday night. He takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only doing this for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You're doing this for you. She just glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're never having sex again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what my friends say about marriage will be true. 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she nervously fights back a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOST leads Winnie and Jacob through the grand dining room. Gordon sees them and stands up. We can tell he's anxious as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Fighting back the nerves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. They just stand there. Jacob holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Gekko, I'm Jacob Moore, we spoke on the phone. Nice to finally meet in person. Gekko just looks at him for an extra long beat, then... shakes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They all sit.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Jacob, shall we get some wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... okay. Then Gordon attempts a smile over to his daughter.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me guess... the ginger garlic lobster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to order that every time. She closes her menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not really hungry. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been following your career, Winnie. Senator Lehigh said some very nice things about you in The American Prospect interview.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She's really been... very... supportive of my... And it trails off... as she just glares at Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this. She exhales, stands and looks down to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I can't do this. And she quickly walks off. Jacob frozen. Until Gordon loo over to him with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. This is a long term investment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go after her. She needs you. And Jacob does. As Gordon looks down... disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pouring rain. Jacob runs after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie... Winnie... He turns her around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand. Her tears being washed away by the rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mother couldn't handle Rudy. He was so out of control. I couldn't help him. Jacob takes her into his hold...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he wasn't in prison... if he had been there. I know it would've been different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother's dead, Winnie. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squeezing her tight...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not the person people think he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a long time ago. She pulls out of his embrace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll hurt us. Can't we just go home? Please... Jacob. It's raining. And he just looks at her for a long moment... soaking wet shivering... crying and exposed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (what am I doing?) I love you. You don't have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. The phone rings. Jacob answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. INTERCUT WITH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your insurance companies are down. He's working a coffee in the master suite of The Black Sw Home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bretton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to increase our size. Glancing at the LCD, 12:23am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Good. It's just a matter of time before they turn. I'll call the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, I want you to triple our positions on all three. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob takes a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they better fucking go up. Click. And as Jacob just looks at the phone...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (PRELAP)
dialogues.text: The instant you know you're in trouble is the exact moment when a sound investment thesis turns into blind hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob sits across from Gordon at this well-known breakfas spot in the Parker Meridian hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tripling the size... that's a very aggressive move. Jacob nods.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And I promise you he's using leverage to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's chasing. Suddenly, a MAN approaches the table. He's in his thirtie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr Gekko, I'm Tom Sanders. I write for Barrons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard of it. Letting out a little laugh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm doing a piece of Wall Street moguls who ended up going to prison. I've already talked to Boesky and Milken and would love to sit down with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give me the cover? Tom isn't sure if Gordon's serious. Either is Jacob. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I... um... don't make those decisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the cover and I'll give you seventy minutes. Tom politely smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll... take that as a no. ... and goes. Gordon looks down to his breakfast and quie asserts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) Both those assholes got the cover when they were convicted. And after a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know the insurance companies are going to continue going down? As he casually places his egg on a piece of toast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all going down. ... and takes a bite.

dialogues.speaker: AND THREE CHARTS NOW FILL THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Side by side... above the charts are written respectively MCC, ACN and ISS. And we follow all the three trend lines from Aug 17th for to the right... and they all move down.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Just wait. And we stop in September. And as a blue circle is formed over Sept 13th on all three charts, we...

dialogues.speaker: TIME WARNER CENTER/BALLROOM
dialogues.text: This is The Financial Follies... an annual event held by financial writers association. 500 people sit at tables, enjoying this dinner and live s that pokes fun at people in the world of finance. Everyone who's anyone in high finance is here. 86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the stage, the spotlight finds BILL MAHER and the appl breaks out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the 2008 Financial Follies!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Bill Maher and I'm getting paid in Euros. Jacob shares a table with Bretton, Bretton's wife and a f other FINANCIAL PLAYERS. Winnie is not here.

dialogues.speaker: BILL MAHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When The Financial Writers Association asked me to host an event for the world of finance, I was shocked. I'm known in Washington not Wall Street...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... but then they informed me that Washington is actually in the process of buying Wall Street, so it all makes sense. Laughter...

dialogues.speaker: BILL MAHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I asked them if anything's off limits. And they said to stay away from the brokerages, banks and insurers... (pause for effect, then...) ... where the fuck was that advice five months ago? More laughter.

dialogues.speaker: BILL MAHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I see Sammy Rosen's here. The spotlight finds SAMMY ROSEN, billionaire hedge funder

dialogues.speaker: BILL MAHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sammy, how are you? From his table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the room) Of course he is... in the amount of time it took for us to have that exchange, he made three hundred and nine thousand dollars. (back to Sammy) Sammy, let me give you some free advice, the next time someone with bad eyesight wants to sell you a hundred and fifty million dollar painting... don't let them personally deliver it. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an inside joke that this room gets...

dialogues.speaker: BILL MAHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Somebody told me Gordon Gekko is here. Gordon... ? Across the room, a spotlight finds Gordon...

dialogues.speaker: BILL MAHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you are. I have some inside information for you, Gekko... sex sells books, not bread lines. Gordon smiles and raises his glass up to Bill.

dialogues.speaker: BILL MAHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Talk about your sour grapes. Seriously Gordon -- just because the SEC doesn't let you make obscene amounts of money by being wrong and nefarious doesn't mean you have to ruin it for all of these hard working people. The room applauds...

dialogues.speaker: BILL MAHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, we have a video to show now. It's a very detailed and academic account of the current mortgage crises. Let `er rip! And the room goes dark... and on the screen plays a child roughly illustrated stick-figure skit being narrated by children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the caption "Main Street National Bank" is a drawin a Poor Man sitting across from a Banker Man behind his de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like a mortgage... I don't really have any money though... is that cool?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally cool. Since housing prices are always going up it won't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are awesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the caption "A few weeks later at the bank..." Banker Man now stands over a pile of steaming shit. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, these mortgages are really beginning to smell. I better sell them to smart people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the caption of "Smart People Investment Bank" Smart stands over the same steaming pile of shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, these mortgages we just bought really smell. I better sell them to foreigners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the caption of "The CDO Factory" our smart man over an assembly line of stick figure workers.

dialogues.speaker: SMART MAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mix those crappy mortgages in real good with the clean ones so the rating agencies won't smell them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the caption of "Rich Man Hedge Fund" a stick figure named Rich Man sits behind his desk and holds a phone to ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good news, Smart Man, not only did foreigners buy those traunches, but so did school boards and charities and big pensions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did they buy them you ask? Well, they were looking for a really secure risk-free investment and they were all triple A, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the caption "Norwegian Village Pension Fund" a Norwegian Man sits behind his desk and shouts into his ph

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey man! What the fuck? We're not receiving our monthly payments!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the caption "Rich Man Hedge Fund," Rich Man at his on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we fucked up. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it now shuffles between the last two frames... the Norwegian Man and Rich Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the rating agencies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they fucked up too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the investment bank that put these CDO's together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the bank that made the original loan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to tell my villagers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you fucked up. The final frame Just the rendering of that steaming pile of shit under th caption... "The End." And the lights go on to a some subdued laughter and a smattering of applause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a year -- enjoy the night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Desert is served. Jackets are off, cigars are lit, Bretto wife has gone home. The group at the table is a little dr and having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good question... what do you think, George? GEORGE, an investment banker at the table, thinks about i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The definition of rich... flying private. The table reacts... some agree, other don't. George turns Jacob. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob... ? What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be rich... is to have the love of a good woman. They all boo...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a smile) For real... I truly believe that. And Jacob turns to Bretton...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bretton... what's your definition of rich? An approaching voice answers it for him.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: To have twice as much money as you currently do. As he takes a seat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't that what you always say, Bretton? Then... announcing to the table...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He brings up the question, runs it round the table then finishes with that. It's an old bit. Also announcing to the table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful Gordon... (looking at Jacob) ... your daughter's financial health is in my hands now. Jacob loses his smile... suddenly becoming uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the way The Locust Fund has been buying up the insurance companies lately makes me worried about my future grandchildren's college educations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't tell him. 91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't suppose you did. Bretton looks over to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go ahead, Jacob, preach your book... defend your names. And Jacob turns to Gordon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a proactive central bank, the charts show a clear bottom on July 15th and these companies are trading at half of what they were six months ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just cause it's low don't make it cheap, Sport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read your book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not out yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a friend in publishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25% unemployment... stagflation... bread lines... Martial law... government seizures of assets and gold... end of democracy... Bretton leans back... taking in this sparring match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really Gordon? Do you really need attention that badly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I have forty-four seconds to spare, I'm going to tell you a story. It's about a guy named Sam. And we go close on Gekko...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sam used to work a job, he made things and he grew things and he sold those things. Until one day Sam got a credit card and was amazed how easy it was to buy things with it. So Sam got another card and then another. Then he used the credit card money to make it look like he had an income... and he used that "income" to secure a loan.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And with that loan Sam bought a fancy BMW car and rented a fancy penthouse apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, the credit cards hit their limit and the bank needed him to service that loan, so Sam went to his friends. His Chinese friend... and his Japanese friend... and his British friend and so on. And his friends loaned Sam money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that brings us to today... where Sam owes the credit cards and Sam owes the banks and Sam owes his friends and eventually they're going to take away Sam's fancy BMW car and his fancy penthouse apartment. And Jacob can now see... in Gordon Gekko's eyes... he tru believes every word he's saying.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Sam doesn't make anything anymore and Sam doesn't grow anything anymore so Sam doesn't sell anything anymore. As he stands...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our favorite Uncle Sam's desperate, Jake... and he just found a printing press in his basement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you tell me -- where do we go from here? And with that, Gordon Gekko goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is sad isn't it? That he can't just take his ball and go home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That he has to piss on the whole game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rushed, Jacob heads through the lobby of his building. Di catches his stride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doing his best Howard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down goes Lehman! Down goes Lehman! Down goes Lehman! And Jacob just keeps walking... 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob heads into the office to find Bretton sitting behin his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not going to save it. They're just going to let it bloody die! And sure enough... on the tv... Fox Business runs footage Lehman Brother's demise. On the screen, the chyron scream

dialogues.speaker: ALEXIS GLICK, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: And as another US banking institution collapses, Congress is working quickly on a bailout package that will distribute over three hundred billion dollars to other banks in trouble. Bretton turns off the tv and looks to Jacob with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting fucking killed. And Jacob looks up to his electronic ticker... MCC $18.53 -2.34, ACN $12.04 -1.35, ISS $7.03 -.65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's capitulation. Bretton holds Jacob's look... fighting to keep his compos Until... he simply stands and offers Jacob his desk back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then buy more. Jacob takes his chair and reaches for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cost us down to current levels. Jacob looks up, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's just a question of time before this turns around... right? And he glares at Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Bretton just stares nervously at the electronic ticker... frazzled gambler talking himself into his bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck it. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he goes...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Leverage is sexy.

dialogues.speaker: AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART
dialogues.text: As a circle forms on Sept 16th then travels down the tren line and stops. And as a circle is formed around the Sept 24th, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LCD reads 4:43 am. Jacob lays awake... staring at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: WINNIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I would hear him in the kitchen. Jacob turns to see she's awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, you have an early train. I'm going to just go to the office now. She leans up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't want to keep my mother awake so he'd go into the kitchen and sit there. I could hear him because my room was right up the back stairs. I'd go and sit with him sometimes. We'd eat ice cream. Jacob gets out of bed and throws on his robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was only eight but I could tell he was worried about something and that made me worried. (softly, almost to herself) Then the market would go back up and he would sleep through the night again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not the market, Winnie. As he sits on the edge of the bed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just that I haven't been able to sleep through the night since... The thought trails off... she leans up and kisses him. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could tell you something was going to come along that would make it better but I can't. It's just going to take time, Jacob. A lot of time. And she looks into his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you been counting Fridays? He slowly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still count Tuesdays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All seven hundred and twenty eight of them. He leans over and kisses her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to sleep. And he goes... After a beat, she sees Jacob's wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out after him) Jacob, you forgot... She jumps out of bed, grabs the wallet and goes after him but... it opens up and Winnie notices the picture inside. And she stops, staring at that picture. Her and her father on that white horse... taken years ago A picture she knows she never gave to Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob heads in and turns on Fox Business...

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN SULLIVAN, (ON TV)
dialogues.text: It's a complete unmitigated bloodbath out there. The S&P tried to rally at about 10am but it was met with yet another brutal wave of selling and people... we're now at our lows for the day, the week, the month and the year. Jacob looks up at ticker on the wall. MCC $15.13 -3.40, ACN $10.10 -1.96, ISS $5.14 -1.89. 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he stares at that ticker... at the The Locust Fund's methodical death. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Are you happy? He stands in the doorway holding a drink.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're done. And Bretton CHUCKS the drink against the wall and the gla shatters. Jacob takes a step back. Bretton's in a complete state as he walks over to Jacob's desk and SWIPES it clean... papers flying about.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Finished... Now he picks up the chair...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bank notices... ... throws it against the window... which cracks.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Margin calls... As he punches the monitor of Jacob's Bloomberg...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Redemptions... And Jacob just stands there... wide-eyed. Just looking at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Face full of sweat... blood all over his hand... hair str about... completely out of breath... bloodshot red eyes.. beaten down mess of a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to composure, Bretton?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I suppose it went to hell with your fucking insurance stocks. And Bretton calms down, walks to the window.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's not making sense to me anymore. The market always made sense to me and for the most part... I was better than it... quicker than it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's moving too fast now and it looks like the world is going to shit anyway. And he faces Jacob Moore.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If I unwind the fund now I'll still walk with six hundred million or so. And Jacob's face falls... this is news to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to call it a day. Spend more time with my family. I suppose this moment comes for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still have six hundred million? Bretton vacantly nods. And Jacob Moore... trying his best to hide his disappointment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost to himself) That's a fortune. With a shrug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it's all relative. Bretton then takes a moment... confirming to himself that this is the right decision... then finally looks over to Jacob with...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And Jacob -- you're the worst portfolio manager I've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheep's meadow... painted in the soft light of sunset. Fr off his morning run, Gordon wears a sweat suit and works vitamin water. Jacob approaches in his suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wants to close the fund... he wants to ride off into the fucking sunset...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not okay... because we're so fucking close... and he's going to walk with six hundred million dollars and that's unacceptable. And Gordon sighs in defeat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to tell you, Pal. You wanted to make him bleed, I wanted my daughter back... As he walks...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... looks like life brings disappointment to us all. And Jacob... as he matches Gordon's stride... in a comple state.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to slaughtering men, Gordon? What happened to turning them into penny-ante brokers in Poughkeepsie? Gordon stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at you. This can't possibly be the man my daughter fell in love with. Jacob turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to finish the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because nobody gave a shit about me before Andrew Zabel came along. Because he didn't deserve what he got.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The universe is an efficient market, Kid... we all get what we deserve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you? Now it's Gordon who looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you cared about him... and I know how that motivates. But Jacob... he wasn't such a Saint. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And with that, Gordon Gekko heads on his way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know. Jacob steps forward... shouting out after him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry she doesn't want anything to do with you, Gordon -- I'm sorry she doesn't love you! Gordon stops walking. Turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay Jake... you want to know. Jacob sharply nods.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Did you ever think about it? I mean really think about it? How someone could make money year after year... even through bear markets? Jacob just stands there... listening...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On November 15th, 1903 an Italian man arrived aboard the S.S. Vancouver in Boston. He had two dollars and fifty cents to his name. Yet just a few years later he was millionaire. You wanna know how? He had invented a scheme... it was quite simple actually. And Jacob now steps forward... piecing it together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He would get people to invest with him by offering larger than normal returns then pay the old investors with the new investors money. As long as there was fresh money, he could keep going. Do you know what his name was, Jacob? It was Charles...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charles Ponzi.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH TO AN OLD BRICK BUILDING
dialogues.text: "Jenkov Foundation For Brain Research" above the door... RESEARCHERS in lab coats coming in and out of it. 100.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Research facilities...

dialogues.speaker: THEN TO A COLLEGE CAMPUS
dialogues.text: STUDENTS walking the quad... wearing backpacks and socializing...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And scholarships...

dialogues.speaker: THEN TO A BIKE PATH
dialogues.text: Somewhere in Florida. A COUPLE in their 70s enjoying a beautiful day... riding bicycles side by side...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And retirees...

dialogues.speaker: AND RIGHT BACK TO CENTRAL PARK
dialogues.text: Gordon steps forward...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All of them went to bed thinking they were perfectly fine... are going to wake up to find they're completely wiped out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not, Son. I wish I were. Jacob just stands there... stunned with what he's hearing

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See Jacob, you knew how to get that out of me. By playing me off of what I really want... my daughter back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you need get Bretton back in the game... play him off of what he really wants. And off Jacob's reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob shares a table with our Morgan Stanley Portfolio Manager.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN PORTFOLIO MANAGER
dialogues.text: It's ugly out there dude. I wake up everyday wondering if today's the day we're going under. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. But I do have something for you... And as Morgan Portfolio Manager leans forward in anticipation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob and Hedge Fund PM walk the floor... checking out new 2009 Prius.

dialogues.speaker: HEDGE FUND PM
dialogues.text: I was going to get the new Maserati, but... you know... Jacob slowly nods. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I heard something earlier today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob jogs with our blogger from Streetaccount.com.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so much better working out outdoors... that gym was so stuffy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention expensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you've obviously heard the rumor? And Blogger looks over to Jacob... he hasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As our blogger from the gym sips his coffee, fires up his computer and starts to type...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Hedge Fund PM stands up to present to the team with a confident smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Morgan Portfolio receives the digital receipt... "1209 instant messages sent."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cab stops outside of the building... 102.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the thunder claps outside. Jacob stares at the Goya painting... Saturno Devorando a sus hijos Saturn. The man being eaten alive.

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I don't like unannounced visits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: United Bancorp is going under. Wells Fargo has stepped up but the offer is insanely low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know all this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still have the fund and you still have the leverage that comes with it. You want out of the game... buy a bank. Bretton skeptically regards Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I got you into those insurance companies... because I let you down... And Bretton... biting his lip in thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like the mortgage toxic waste. It can't be quantified... and it spreads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked it out already. You wouldn't have to take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Wells won't insure the Zabel institutional money. It's against their policy. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told them you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then who would take on the mortgage securities? 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Sam. Bretton slowly nods... taking all this in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'd get the bank, the KZI assets including the institutional fund yet none of the mortgage securities. As Jacob leans forward... going in for the kill...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could actually own the bank your father toiled away at his whole career. Think about that, Bretton. Bretton just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to lose our credit. I'm facing margin calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So in order to stay in the game... we need fresh money. Bretton nods...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not going to work) Oil's crashing. Jacob thinks for a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how much do we need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty, sixty million minimum... and that's just to hold off the current margin calls. And Bretton just sighs...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God, de-leveraging is a bitch. Standing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit tight. I'm going to get us the money. And Jacob goes... Bretton calling out after him... 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From who... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Moral Hazard! Why Wall Street Has Finally Gone Too Far" now everywhere. In large cut outs and piles on tables and in the store's windows. Jacob arrives at the end of the line... New York's newest best selling author is having a book signing.

dialogues.speaker: AND GORDON GEKKO
dialogues.text: Signs a book and looks up at the LADY who gave it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a question... what exactly is "moral hazard?" With a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Short version -- taking risks you're not accountable for with other people's money. And the next person steps up and hands Gordon a copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going for it. We're almost home. As he signs it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
