dialogues.text: There you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he needs fresh money to serve the leverage. A hundred million. Gordon just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a writer now. We don't make that much. As the line of people holding their new books start to ge impatient...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that, but I figured you might know how to get it. Handing Jacob back the signed copy... 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you need money that badly, Jake... you might want to check closer to home. Off Jacob's confused reaction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they walk the mall... the Nation's Capitol behind them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Jacob. I never really considered it mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it is... right? It's your money? And she faces him... regarding his urgency...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glaring at him) You might want to wipe some of the drool off your face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding. This is important. As they continue to walk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it's mine. When he went to prison, my father put a lot of money in our names. And when Rudy died it all became mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's in a trust. I can't get to it until I'm thirty-five and even then I was planning on giving it to charity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say I can figure out a way for you to get it. Take a loan against it -- something like that. Will you do that for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this, Jacob? Jacob takes a moment... looking away with... 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my only chance to make things right, Winnie. And she just regards him... not sure... INT. MILBANK,TWEED,HADLEY & MCCLOY LAW OFFICES - DAY As Jacob walks down the hall with KEN HADLEY, estate lawy to Manhattan's elite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon couldn't invest any of his money so he put most of it into the children's names with directions on how it was to be invested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He definitely knew what he was doing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how could Winnie get it now? Hadley stops walking and thinks about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she'd have to sign a reversion of trust document. That way the funds would revert back to their pre-trust posture and regulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So all she has to do is sign a piece of paper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically. As that registers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's complicated. There's private equity ownership, real estate, a very large position in a bank... all sorts of investment vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ballpark it for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Assuming immediate liquidity... over three hundred million. And with that, Jacob sets to go. But... 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... Gordon would have to sign the document as well.

dialogues.speaker: AND GORDON GEKKO
dialogues.text: In the make-up chair of the Fox Business channel green ro speaks into his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You also would need the trust's executor to sign it. INTERCUT WITH... Jacob as he walks down 5th avenue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy Redding. He's a lifelong friend. It won't be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would love to sign it, Jacob. Consider it done. Walking down 5th avenue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you, Gordon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just after you agree to two things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Bretton buys the bank, he must use all of Winnie's money and all the Locust Fund's leverage to go against the market. They're about to pass this bailout and I want to be on the other side of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This thing's going to hell in a bucket and I'm sick of being on sidelines, Pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just for a few weeks then it's right back to our plan. 108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accepting that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the second thing... ? And as that hangs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she starts to sign the forms... we're in... INT. MILBANK, TWEED, HADLEY & MCCLOY/CONFERENCE ROOM Silence. A clock ticks. A large table. Three LAWYERS sit on one side. Winnie and Jacob on the other and Gordon at head. Winnie finishes signing the forms then slides them back t Hadley who hands them to Gordon. Jacob takes her hand but she pulls it away. And after Gordon signs the papers, they all stand. Gordon just looks at Winnie, who's now looking back at hi Tears beginning to well. And he slowly opens his arms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie... come here... you're all I have left now. And she slowly walks over to him... to his embrace...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He was my only son. And I messed that up. I messed it all up, I know that. She's now crying.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But please... forgive me... And confirming through her tears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You always get what you want, Dad. And Jacob Moore... witnessing this strange reunion... realizing how right she is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob's on the phone in his office, watching coverage of vote on the Senate floor... 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) Okay, it looks like this bailout's going to pass...

dialogues.speaker: SPLIT THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: Robby, with a phone to his ear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) ... there's going to be an initial bounce... SPLIT THE SCREEN AGAIN... AND AGAIN... AND AGAIN... Each time to another broker with a phone to their ear... six brokers from before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his phone) We're going to sell that bounce.

dialogues.speaker: AND THEN FOX BUSINESS NEWS COVERAGE
dialogues.text: Day by day... Alexis Glick starting off the day's coverag And each new day finds Alexis in a different outfit with different headline above her head. We don't hear her, it moves quickly and it's ugly.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: First we're going to unload all of our positions in the insurers.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then we're going to go the other way... we're going to bet against this market... aggressively.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Against the S&P, the Nasdaq, the Dow...

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... the financials, China, India, Brazil...

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... the brokerages that are still left, all the froth from the last two years...

dialogues.speaker: AND WERE BACK ON THE CHART
dialogues.text: As a circle forms on October 10th then travels the trend down even further to late October and stops.

dialogues.speaker: JACOB, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Gentlemen, anything that can be sold... we're going to sell. And as a circle is formed around the date of October 27th we...

dialogues.speaker: INT. 533 THIRD AVENUE/LOBBY- MORNING
dialogues.text: Jacob gets off the elevator and sees Diego who doesn't sa anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No market joke today? Diego just shrugs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It stopped being funny. Jacob softly nods and heads on his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob heads in to find Bretton waiting for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were in London. Jacob nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The United Bancorp deal is going to go through. I've begun unwinding all our positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But our deal with Gordon was that we have to stay short until November 5th. Bretton just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, Gordon redeemed all his money yesterday. We're clean with him. And this hits Jacob like a ton of bricks...

dialogues.speaker: BRETTON WOODS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No, everything's great. Forcing out a smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go buy a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the LANDLORD walks down the hall with Jacob and Winnie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, he hasn't answered his phone and we're very worried. The landlord nods and unlocks the apartment door for them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they walk in to find the place completely empty. Everything's gone save for one thing... that framed pictu of the woman filling her stove with money. Jacob slowly walks over to the it and stares it down...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He played me... She joins his side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He played us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't give a shit about the money. And she turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is who he is. He sucks in a deep breath, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lied to you. I contacted him. I spent time with him. Without you knowing. 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the picture in your wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why didn't you say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I wanted to give you a chance to say something first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I love you, I really do. She takes off the "fuck you" ring...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And because I desperately wanted to find something in you to believe in. (shaking her head in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Jacob... you've become that exact thing I've been trying to master... ... and places it into his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you've become him. INT. MILBANK, TWEED, HADLEY & MCCLOY OFFICES - MORNIN Hadley sits behind his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's completely legal, Jacob. The funds reverted back to the pre-trust posture... that means the money was technically Gordon's again. Hadley just shrugs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he's not allowed to trade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't trade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He put the money into the hedge fund, that's considered capital investment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, Gordon never put the money into a hedge fund. He simply took control of the bank. 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank? What bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudson River. I told you about the position in the bank. Jacob's stunned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hudson River... ? I don't understand.

dialogues.speaker: SLAM INTO/BUCHANAN NEW YORK
dialogues.text: A sleepy town...

dialogues.speaker: HADLEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well, Gordon had placed his Hudson River shares into the trust before he was convicted. You do know he started out there? A rental car parks out front of a small bank. Jacob emerg and heads for the bank...

dialogues.speaker: HADLEY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, then the trust aggressively acquired more shares about two years ago... enough to have a controlling position in the bank. And Jacob stops walking when he sees... a group of angry depositors forming outside and a sign hanging in the doorway... "Closed."

dialogues.speaker: AND RIGHT BACK TO
dialogues.text: Jacob and Hadley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how? Gordon wasn't allowed to control the trust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. All of the trust's moves were made by its executor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy Redding? Confused...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sammy Redding? Who the hell is Sammy Redding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, the executor of Winnie's trust has always been Bretton Woods. And as that slams into Jacob Moore... 114.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob takes his seat and settles in for the long fligh He's flying commercial... and in coach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining and gray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob walks the hallowed halls of this old school stoc brokerage with the MANAGER...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're throwing Bretton's birthday party at Balmoral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're very proud to have such a resounding success hail from these hallowed halls I assure you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've been trying to get Bretton to come back and speak to our younger brokers, but... he's a hard man to reach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny because he often speaks about his days here at Redmayne and Bentley... anyway, what I'm hoping you can help me with were records of his early trades. Years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think it'll be fun to bring up some of Bretton's real losers from when he was starting out... you know we all have dogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course... but it is against policy to allow just anyone to see those records.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I completely understand. How about this? I'll make you a trade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You let me see the records for Bretton's party... And with a killer smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and I'll make sure Bretton gives your young brokers a speech that will blow them away. 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Jacob looks over the old documents... trading ledgers twenty-five years ago. Down the list we see him circle all the unusually large successful trades. And then follow them to the client # o the right side of the ledger. And Jacob realizes it's the same client # every time. Cli #41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, Bretton -- you really kicked some ass for client forty one. Finally Jacob turns to the back of the ledger, to the cli key, where he moves the pencil down to client #41 and it says... Gordon Gekko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (all making sense now) Bud Fox wasn't the only one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob waits in the large entry hall... holding a cheap umbrella he bought at Heathrow. And down from the stairs walks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been a bitch of a month, my friend... tell me this visit does not bring bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oleg sips his vodka and looks at Jacob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to audit The Locust Fund?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. I want you to tell Bretton you need the official records of all the fund's activity starting with when you gave him the original two hundred million. You need this because The Russian Federal Tax Service is up your ass and you have to play ball with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if he declines... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have no choice but to pull your money. 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oleg lights a cigarette... exhaling the smoke with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And why would I do that? And Jacob leans forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if you do this for me, Oleg, I'll teach you the Andrew Zabel magic. I'll explain to you, in detail, all of his techniques... I'll give you all his secrets... it's less complicated than you might think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness, until... a phone rings. Jacob wakes up and take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... Okay, thank you. He moves to the curtains then opens them. And the daylight spills in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oleg slides four encyclopedia-sized bounded stacks of printouts across his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the Locust Fund's trades for the last two years. Jacob nods, placing them into his bag. And Oleg lights a cigarette... looks right at us... excited... leaning forward with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now give it to me. Let me behind the Andrew Zabel curtain...

dialogues.speaker: INT. 767
dialogues.text: As Jacob flies back to New York. He flips through the Loc Fund trading ledgers, shaking his head in disbelief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie answers the door to find...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were working together. Your father and Bretton. Walking back into the apartment... 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jacob, what are you doing here? Following her in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gordon wanted the trust the whole time. And when I came to him seeking revenge... he saw his window. Upset, she looks for her keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bretton owed him a favor because he fed your father information twenty three years ago when he was a young broker in London and your father never ratted him out. She just looks at him... shaking her head... and not in disapproval... but in pity. But he keeps going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he never put the money into Bretton's fund. Turns out your trust had built up a controlling position in Hudson River Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the bank he worked at when I was born.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now he owns it. Or shall I say pilfered it before he went AWOL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that money wasn't even the bank's... it was taxpayers'... bailout money. As this washes over a stunned Winnie Gekko...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus... And Jacob confirms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saw this coming years ago... from his cell. I'm guessing he made off with billions. And he throws something on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now look? 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a copy of Portfolio Magazine with a picture of Gordo cover under the headline... "Guess Who's Back and Getting Rich Betting Against You?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in London... giving interviews and being hailed as a genius. Everyone's buying his book and waiting to see his next move. Desperately trying to get her mind around this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what about the SEC, the regulatory agencies-- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The government is flying this 700 billion dollar airplane by the seat of it's pants. They don't know where half of the fucking money is going. And even if they did, do you think they want this out there? As this all washes over her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is his revenge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup... sure beats the hell out of insider trading, doesn't it? And Winnie finds her keys and heads for the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hear anymore of this. ... but Jacob steps in front of her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done. I sold everything. The ring. Everything. I gave back the KZI bonus. I'm out and I'm broke and I deserve it. And she just looks at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Winnie, the one thing I can't accept -- is losing you. And before she reacts...

dialogues.speaker: WERE BACK ON THE CHART
dialogues.text: As a circle forms on Nov 6th then travels quite a ways th finally stops. Unfortunately, this slope down the S&P trendline is quite pronounced. 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as a circle is formed around Jan 24th 2009, we...

dialogues.speaker: THE CABIN OF A BOEING 777
dialogues.text: As Jacob opens up a copy of Barron's... Gekko on the cove under the caption "What's His Next Move?"

dialogues.speaker: AND BRETTON WOODS
dialogues.text: In an official office of our Federal Reserve Bank, proudl signing the documents...

dialogues.speaker: AND ALONG THE BANKS OF THE PERSIAN GULF
dialogues.text: Dubai in the background. Jacob waits against a bench. And across the way he sees... approaching him... Gordon Gekko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see Barrons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You finally got the cover. Gordon nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody thinks you got rich of betting against the system. If they only knew...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The powers that be will never let that happen. Jacob's not arguing it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much is enough, Gordon? Gordon laughs with a shake of the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been asked that before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They took a hundred, twenty two thousand, six hundred and forty hours from me... for a goddamn victimless crime. All the while I sit in my 8 by 12 and watch real crooks by the thousands give out mortgages like candy, package them into unexplainable derivatives and spit the cancer out into the world. And he just shakes his head... 120.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And when I get out... who's there waiting for me? Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better believe I'm going to get mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to miss America?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll always have America... it's why I'm here. I'm buying the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's kitschy but it's fun and good for business. Looking over the water...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have a lot business abroad now. Interests in an Australian copper mine, a German solar company, some Russian oil pipelines, a casino in Macau... see Jake, America just isn't where the action is anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to the precious depreciating asset of time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It still trades... And he turns to Jacob with a smile...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ... but I'm a billionaire now, Pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out, Gordon, I'm done trading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why. You pulled it off, Kid, you took him down -- granted with my help -- but you atoned for Zabel's sins with Bretton's money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As I see it, you're just getting started. And Jacob stops walking then slowly turns to Gordon with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever really want to reconcile with her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (of course I did) I'm human. 121.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glaring at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why did you do it? And Gordon... strongly holding Jacob's glare... simply replies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it didn't work. Gordon sadly shrugs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been trying to wire two hundred million into her bank account but she won't accept it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. She doesn't want it... we don't want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's not about what you have... it's about what you do. And Gordon -- it's never about the money. Gordon shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds good. I bet you can even wrap it in a pretty red bow. But Champ, it's idealistic... and idealism kills every trade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie will realize that at some point... and then we'll be fine. And Jacob finally looks away... in pity.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See Jacob -- the hustle we all fall for is actually thinking we can fight what's inherent, what's inevitable... that we can somehow undo what genetics, or God, or whatever name you wanna tag it, has placed deep inside of us. Because whether it's greed or revenge or the compulsion to chase... it all amounts to the same thing... loss of control. And it's always going to be there and it's always going to be stronger than you, Pal. Now walking again... 122.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It's why bubbles will always exist and it's why we're all currently in this mess. Joining Gordon's stride...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie's pregnant. And Gordon stops walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be a boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bad out there, Gordon, people are panicked. They're not looking to their government. They're not looking to their trusted advisors. They're looking to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to buy? And Jacob Moore... slowly confirming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Publicly and aggressively. Gordon just looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they're all lemmings. Simple psychology. You once said every crash should have a JP Morgan to step in and save it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well Gordon -- this is your chance to be JP Morgan. And now Gordon shakes his head...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're far from the bottom. It'll be a dead cat bounce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll buy us time. That's all I'm asking for... time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for the new administration to put their plan into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I get in return? 123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Gordon turns... takes in the city of Dubai... in all o its ridiculous splendor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full clemency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can offer that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your daughter can. She works with the new Secretary of Treasury now. Considering that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winnie. Me. Your grandson. Something money can't buy... a family. And Gordon looks at him for the longest moments, allowing all to register, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry son -- that's simply a trade I cannot make. And as Gordon Gekko walks off... leaving Jacob Moore behind...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You wanna know what the mother of all bubbles was? Us. The human race. Scientists call it the Cambrian Explosion, from the Cambrian fauna.

dialogues.speaker: AND RONALD REAGAN NATIONAL AIRPORT
dialogues.text: As Jacob heads into the baggage claim area to see Winnie waiting for him...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It happened 530 million years ago... when all of the sudden, there was the seemingly rapid appearance of most major groups of complex animals. And as they embrace...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And from it was born humanity.

dialogues.speaker: AND GORDON GEKKO
dialogues.text: Being led through a massive empty space... office space.. 124.

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It was an explosion of life. Scientists will tell you it was unprecedented, excessive and by the standards of evolution-time... happened in a flash. The City of London outside the large windows...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Suddenly the world had millions of new species... just like that. This will be the home of his new international empire.

dialogues.speaker: AND BRETTON WOODS
dialogues.text: At his desk in his 15 CPW penthouse...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: See -- bubbles are the purest form of Darwinism. ... looking over pages and pages of destruction... Andrew Zabel's legacy that he now has to pay for...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They teach us what we didn't know and they remind us of what we forgot... And Bretton completely loses it... just starts ripping ou the pages then tearing them in two...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They kill excess and they lean out the herd. ... methodically... page by page... over and over again..

dialogues.speaker: AND GORDON GEKKO
dialogues.text: Sitting in his massive London office. It's empty. It's night. He's completely alone. He looks up at the wall... at the framed picture of JP Mo and Uncle Sam rowing that boat. Then he looks down at an old picture of Winnie... she's probably three or four years old... and lovingly holding baby brother, Rudy. And Gordon holds on this picture for a long moment, befor finally...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They actually bring us back to the necessary simple... 125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... picking up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: AND GORDON GEKKO
dialogues.text: Now in the back of a Town Car... we don't know where...

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Because Jacob... As the door opens, daylight spills in and we see the char bull of Bowling Green Park across the way... Gordon is escorted out of the car and led to the doors of New York stock exchange. And Gordon stops at the famed doors, takes a moment to re the exchange, sucks in a deep breath, readies for his her welcome and finally... opens the doors then disappears inside.

dialogues.speaker: AND WINNIE AND JACOB
dialogues.text: Greet the morning in their small Washington DC apartment. Winnie pouring coffee, Jacob turning on the TV. And on the screen is a picture of Gordon Gekko walking th floor of the New York stock exchange under the graphic... "Gekko Now Betting On A Recovery."

dialogues.speaker: GORDON GEKKO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... you'd be amazed what can rise from the ashes. Sam Cooke's "A Change Is Gonna Come" kicks in. And we go close on the Fox Business Channel's coverage of market's huge rally of an opening... with Gordon Gekko ringing the bell... until the channel suddenly changes... the cartoon network... while we... FADE OUT.
